652.text: Psalm 44:3	For they obtained not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thy arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favor to them.

653.text: Psalm 44:4	Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.

654.text: Psalm 44:5	Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name we will tread them under that rise up against us.

655.text: Psalm 44:6	For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

656.text: Psalm 44:7	But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

657.text: Psalm 44:8	In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

658.text: Psalm 44:9	But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

659.text: Psalm 44:10	Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they who hate us plunder for themselves.

660.text: Psalm 44:11	Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for food; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

661.text: Psalm 44:12	Thou sellest thy people for naught, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.

662.text: Psalm 44:13	Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and a derision to them that are around us.

663.text: Psalm 44:14	Thou makest us a by-word among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

664.text: Psalm 44:15	My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

665.text: Psalm 44:16	For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

666.text: Psalm 44:17	All this is come upon us; yet we have not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

667.text: Psalm 44:18	Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;

668.text: Psalm 44:19	Though thou hast severely broke us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shades of death.

669.text: Psalm 44:20	If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

670.text: Psalm 44:21	Will not God search out this? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

671.text: Psalm 44:22	Yes, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

672.text: Psalm 44:23	Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.

673.text: Psalm 44:24	Why hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

674.text: Psalm 44:25	For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth to the earth.

675.text: Psalm 44:26	Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.

676.text: Psalm 45:1	To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, for the sons of Korah, Maschil, A Song of loves. My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made concerning the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

677.text: Psalm 45:2	Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.

678.text: Psalm 45:3	Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.

679.text: Psalm 45:4	And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

680.text: Psalm 45:5	Thy arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; by which the people fall under thee.

681.text: Psalm 45:6	Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the scepter of thy kingdom is a scepter of justice.

682.text: Psalm 45:7	Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

683.text: Psalm 45:8	All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, by which they have made thee glad.

684.text: Psalm 45:9	Kings daughters were among thy honorable women: upon thy right hand stood the queen in gold of Ophir.

685.text: Psalm 45:10	Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thy ear; forget also thy own people, and thy father’s house;

686.text: Psalm 45:11	So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy lord; and worship thou him.

687.text: Psalm 45:12	And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall entreat thy favor.

688.text: Psalm 45:13	The king’s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.

689.text: Psalm 45:14	She shall be brought to the king in raiment of needle-work: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought to thee.

690.text: Psalm 45:15	With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king’s palace.

691.text: Psalm 45:16	Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.

692.text: Psalm 45:17	I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.

693.text: Psalm 46:1	To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, A Song upon Alamoth. God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

694.text: Psalm 46:2	Therefore will we not fear, though the earth shall be removed, and though the mountains shall be carried into the midst of the sea;

695.text: Psalm 46:3	Though its waters shall roar and be disturbed, though the mountains shake with the swelling of it. Selah.

696.text: Psalm 46:4	There is a river, the streams of which shall make glad the city of God, the holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.

697.text: Psalm 46:5	God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, and that right early.

698.text: Psalm 46:6	The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.

699.text: Psalm 46:7	The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

700.text: Psalm 46:8	Come, behold the works of the LORD, what desolations he hath made in the earth.

701.text: Psalm 46:9	He maketh wars to cease to the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear asunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.

702.text: Psalm 46:10	Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

703.text: Psalm 46:11	The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

704.text: Psalm 47:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. O clap your hands, all ye people; shout to God with the voice of triumph.

705.text: Psalm 47:2	For the LORD most high is terrible; he is a great King over all the earth.

706.text: Psalm 47:3	He shall subdue the people under us, and the nations under our feet.

707.text: Psalm 47:4	He shall choose our inheritance for us, the excellence of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.

708.text: Psalm 47:5	God is gone up with a shout, the LORD with the sound of a trumpet.

709.text: Psalm 47:6	Sing praises to God, sing praises: sing praises to our King, sing praises.

710.text: Psalm 47:7	For God is the King of all the earth: sing ye praises with understanding.

711.text: Psalm 47:8	God reigneth over the heathen: God sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.

712.text: Psalm 47:9	The princes of the people are assembled, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong to God: he is greatly exalted.

713.text: Psalm 48:1	A Song and Psalm for the sons of Korah. Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the mountain of his holiness.

714.text: Psalm 48:2	Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.

715.text: Psalm 48:3	God is known in her palaces for a refuge.

716.text: Psalm 48:4	For lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.

717.text: Psalm 48:5	They saw it, and so they wondered; they were troubled, and hasted away.

718.text: Psalm 48:6	Fear took hold upon them there, and pain, as of a woman in travail.

719.text: Psalm 48:7	Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.

720.text: Psalm 48:8	As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. Selah.

721.text: Psalm 48:9	We have thought of thy loving-kindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.

722.text: Psalm 48:10	According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise to the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.

723.text: Psalm 48:11	Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.

724.text: Psalm 48:12	Walk about Zion, and go round her: number her towers.

725.text: Psalm 48:13	Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces; that ye may tell it to the generation following.

726.text: Psalm 48:14	For this God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide even to death.

727.text: Psalm 49:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:

728.text: Psalm 49:2	Both low and high, rich and poor together.

729.text: Psalm 49:3	My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.

730.text: Psalm 49:4	I will incline my ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

731.text: Psalm 49:5	Why should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall encompass me?

732.text: Psalm 49:6	They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

733.text: Psalm 49:7	None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

734.text: Psalm 49:8	(For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

735.text: Psalm 49:9	That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

736.text: Psalm 49:10	For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

737.text: Psalm 49:11	Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.

738.text: Psalm 49:12	Nevertheless man being in honor abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.

739.text: Psalm 49:13	This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

740.text: Psalm 49:14	Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

741.text: Psalm 49:15	But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

742.text: Psalm 49:16	Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

743.text: Psalm 49:17	For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

744.text: Psalm 49:18	Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

745.text: Psalm 49:19	He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

746.text: Psalm 49:20	Man that is in honor, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.

747.text: Psalm 50:1	A Psalm of Asaph. The mighty God, even the LORD, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising to the setting of the sun.

748.text: Psalm 50:2	Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.

749.text: Psalm 50:3	Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous around him.

750.text: Psalm 50:4	He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.

751.text: Psalm 50:5	Gather my saints together to me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

752.text: Psalm 50:6	And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

753.text: Psalm 50:7	Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.

754.text: Psalm 50:8	I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt-offerings, to have been continually before me.

755.text: Psalm 50:9	I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he-goats out of thy folds.

756.text: Psalm 50:10	For every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.

757.text: Psalm 50:11	I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.

758.text: Psalm 50:12	If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fullness thereof.

759.text: Psalm 50:13	Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

760.text: Psalm 50:14	Offer to God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows to the Most High:

761.text: Psalm 50:15	And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

762.text: Psalm 50:16	But to the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?

763.text: Psalm 50:17	Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.

764.text: Psalm 50:18	When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

765.text: Psalm 50:19	Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

766.text: Psalm 50:20	Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thy own mother’s son.

767.text: Psalm 50:21	These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.

768.text: Psalm 50:22	Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.

769.text: Psalm 50:23	Whoever offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his deportment aright will I show the salvation of God.

770.text: Psalm 51:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba. Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy loving-kindness: according to the multitude of thy tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.

771.text: Psalm 51:2	Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

772.text: Psalm 51:3	For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.

773.text: Psalm 51:4	Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mayest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.

774.text: Psalm 51:5	Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.

775.text: Psalm 51:6	Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

776.text: Psalm 51:7	Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

777.text: Psalm 51:8	Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

778.text: Psalm 51:9	Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.

779.text: Psalm 51:10	Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.

780.text: Psalm 51:11	Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

781.text: Psalm 51:12	Restore to me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.

782.text: Psalm 51:13	Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted to thee.

783.text: Psalm 51:14	Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

784.text: Psalm 51:15	O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall show forth thy praise.

785.text: Psalm 51:16	For thou desirest not sacrifice: else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt-offering.

786.text: Psalm 51:17	The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

787.text: Psalm 51:18	Do good in thy good pleasure to Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

788.text: Psalm 51:19	Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt-offering and whole burnt-offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thy altar.

789.text: Psalm 52:1	To the chief Musician, Maschil, A Psalm of David, when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said to him, David is come to the house of Ahimelech. Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually.

790.text: Psalm 52:2	Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

791.text: Psalm 52:3	Thou lovest evil more than good; and lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.

792.text: Psalm 52:4	Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.

793.text: Psalm 52:5	God shall likewise destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling-place, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.

794.text: Psalm 52:6	The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:

795.text: Psalm 52:7	Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.

796.text: Psalm 52:8	But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.

797.text: Psalm 52:9	I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it: and I will wait on thy name; for it is good before thy saints.

798.text: Psalm 53:1	To the chief Musician upon Mahalath, Maschil, A Psalm of David. The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.

799.text: Psalm 53:2	God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.

800.text: Psalm 53:3	Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

801.text: Psalm 53:4	Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread! they have not called upon God.

802.text: Psalm 53:5	There they were in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them.

803.text: Psalm 53:6	O that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

804.text: Psalm 54:1	To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, A Psalm of David, when the Ziphims came and said to Saul, Doth not David hide himself with us? Save me, O God, by thy name, and judge me by thy strength.

805.text: Psalm 54:2	Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.

806.text: Psalm 54:3	For strangers have risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.

807.text: Psalm 54:4	Behold, God is my helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

808.text: Psalm 54:5	He will reward evil to my enemies; cut them off in thy truth.

809.text: Psalm 54:6	I will freely sacrifice to thee: I will praise thy name, O LORD; for it is good.

810.text: Psalm 54:7	For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and my eye hath seen its desire upon my enemies.

811.text: Psalm 55:1	To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, A Psalm of David. Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.

812.text: Psalm 55:2	Attend to me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;

813.text: Psalm 55:3	Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

814.text: Psalm 55:4	My heart is severely pained within me: and the terrors of death have fallen upon me.

815.text: Psalm 55:5	Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

816.text: Psalm 55:6	And I said, O that I had wings like a dove! for then I would fly away, and be at rest.

817.text: Psalm 55:7	Lo, then I would wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.

818.text: Psalm 55:8	I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.

819.text: Psalm 55:9	Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

820.text: Psalm 55:10	Day and night they go about it upon its walls: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

821.text: Psalm 55:11	Wickedness is in the midst of it: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

822.text: Psalm 55:12	For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that magnified himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

823.text: Psalm 55:13	But it was thou, a man my equal, my guide, and my acquaintance.

824.text: Psalm 55:14	We took sweet counsel together, and walked to the house of God in company.

825.text: Psalm 55:15	Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

826.text: Psalm 55:16	As for me, I will call upon God: and the LORD will save me.

827.text: Psalm 55:17	Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he will hear my voice.

828.text: Psalm 55:18	He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.

829.text: Psalm 55:19	God will hear and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

830.text: Psalm 55:20	He hath put forth his hands against such as are at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.

831.text: Psalm 55:21	The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.

832.text: Psalm 55:22	Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he will sustain thee: he will never suffer the righteous to be moved.

833.text: Psalm 55:23	But thou, O God, wilt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.

834.text: Psalm 56:1	To the chief Musician upon Jonathelem-rechokim, Michtam of David, when the Philistines took him in Gath. Be merciful to me, O God: for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.

835.text: Psalm 56:2	My enemies would daily swallow me up: for they are many that fight against me, O thou Most High.

836.text: Psalm 56:3	In the time when I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

837.text: Psalm 56:4	In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do to me.

838.text: Psalm 56:5	Every day they wrest my words: all their thoughts are against me for evil.

839.text: Psalm 56:6	They assemble themselves, they hide themselves, they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.

840.text: Psalm 56:7	Shall they escape by iniquity; in thy anger cast down the people, O God.

841.text: Psalm 56:8	Thou numberest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

842.text: Psalm 56:9	When I cry to thee, then shall my enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.

843.text: Psalm 56:10	In God will I praise his word: in the LORD will I praise his word.

844.text: Psalm 56:11	In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do to me.

845.text: Psalm 56:12	Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises to thee.

846.text: Psalm 56:13	For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt thou not deliver my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?

847.text: Psalm 57:1	To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David, when he fled from Saul in the cave. Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me: for my soul trusteth in thee: yes, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, until these calamities are overpast.

848.text: Psalm 57:2	I will cry to God most high; to God that performeth all things for me.

849.text: Psalm 57:3	He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.

850.text: Psalm 57:4	My soul is among lions: and I lie even among them that are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

851.text: Psalm 57:5	Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.

852.text: Psalm 57:6	They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down: they have digged a pit before me, into the midst of which they have fallen themselves. Selah.

853.text: Psalm 57:7	My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing and give praise.

854.text: Psalm 57:8	Awake, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

855.text: Psalm 57:9	I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: I will sing to thee among the nations.

856.text: Psalm 57:10	For thy mercy is great to the heavens, and thy truth to the clouds.

857.text: Psalm 57:11	Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: let thy glory be above all the earth.

858.text: Psalm 58:1	To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David. Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?

859.text: Psalm 58:2	Yes, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.

860.text: Psalm 58:3	The wicked are estranged from their birth: they go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.

861.text: Psalm 58:4	Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;

862.text: Psalm 58:5	Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.

863.text: Psalm 58:6	Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD.

864.text: Psalm 58:7	Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

865.text: Psalm 58:8	As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.

866.text: Psalm 58:9	Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.

867.text: Psalm 58:10	The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

868.text: Psalm 58:11	So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.

869.text: Psalm 59:1	To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him. Deliver me from my enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.

870.text: Psalm 59:2	Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

871.text: Psalm 59:3	For lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.

872.text: Psalm 59:4	They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.

873.text: Psalm 59:5	Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

874.text: Psalm 59:6	They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go about the city.

875.text: Psalm 59:7	Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

876.text: Psalm 59:8	But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

877.text: Psalm 59:9	Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defense.

878.text: Psalm 59:10	The God of my mercy will succor me: God will let me see my desire upon my enemies.

879.text: Psalm 59:11	Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

880.text: Psalm 59:12	For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.

881.text: Psalm 59:13	Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob to the ends of the earth. Selah.

882.text: Psalm 59:14	And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go about the city.

883.text: Psalm 59:15	Let them wander up and down for food, and grudge if they are not satisfied.

884.text: Psalm 59:16	But I will sing of thy power; yes, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.

885.text: Psalm 59:17	To thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defense, and the God of my mercy.

886.text: Psalm 60:1	To the chief Musician upon Shushan-eduth, Michtam of David, to teach; when he strove with Aram-naharaim and with Aram-zobah, when Joab returned, and smote of Edom in the valley of salt twelve thousand. O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.

887.text: Psalm 60:2	Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal its breaches; for it shaketh.

888.text: Psalm 60:3	Thou hast shown thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.

889.text: Psalm 60:4	Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.

890.text: Psalm 60:5	That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.

891.text: Psalm 60:6	God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.

892.text: Psalm 60:7	Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my lawgiver;

893.text: Psalm 60:8	Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.

894.text: Psalm 60:9	Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

895.text: Psalm 60:10	Wilt thou not, O God, who hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, who didst not go out with our armies?

896.text: Psalm 60:11	Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

897.text: Psalm 60:12	Through God we shall do valiantly: for he will tread down our enemies.

898.text: Psalm 61:1	To the chief Musician upon Neginah, A Psalm of David. Hear my cry, O God; attend to my prayer.

899.text: Psalm 61:2	From the end of the earth will I cry to thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

900.text: Psalm 61:3	For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.

901.text: Psalm 61:4	I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.

902.text: Psalm 61:5	For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.

903.text: Psalm 61:6	Thou wilt prolong the king’s life: and his years as many generations.

904.text: Psalm 61:7	He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.

905.text: Psalm 61:8	So will I sing praise to thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.

906.text: Psalm 62:1	To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of David. Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.

907.text: Psalm 62:2	He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defense; I shall not be greatly moved.

908.text: Psalm 62:3	How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.

909.text: Psalm 62:4	They only consult to cast him down from his excellence: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

910.text: Psalm 62:5	My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.

911.text: Psalm 62:6	He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defense; I shall not be moved.

912.text: Psalm 62:7	In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.

913.text: Psalm 62:8	Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.

914.text: Psalm 62:9	Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.

915.text: Psalm 62:10	Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

916.text: Psalm 62:11	God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth to God.

917.text: Psalm 62:12	Also to thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.

918.text: Psalm 63:1	A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;

919.text: Psalm 63:2	To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.

920.text: Psalm 63:3	Because thy loving-kindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.

921.text: Psalm 63:4	Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.

922.text: Psalm 63:5	My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

923.text: Psalm 63:6	When I remember thee upon my bed, and meditate on thee in the night watches.

924.text: Psalm 63:7	Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

925.text: Psalm 63:8	My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.

926.text: Psalm 63:9	But those that seek my soul to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.

927.text: Psalm 63:10	They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.

928.text: Psalm 63:11	But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.

929.text: Psalm 64:1	To the chief Musician, a Psalm of David. Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

930.text: Psalm 64:2	Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:

931.text: Psalm 64:3	Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:

932.text: Psalm 64:4	That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

933.text: Psalm 64:5	They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who will see them?

934.text: Psalm 64:6	They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.

935.text: Psalm 64:7	But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.

936.text: Psalm 64:8	So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.

937.text: Psalm 64:9	And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.

938.text: Psalm 64:10	The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.

939.text: Psalm 65:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm and Song of David. Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Zion: and to thee shall the vow be performed.

940.text: Psalm 65:2	O thou that hearest prayer, to thee shall all flesh come.

941.text: Psalm 65:3	Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.

942.text: Psalm 65:4	Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach to thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

943.text: Psalm 65:5	By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:

944.text: Psalm 65:6	Who by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:

945.text: Psalm 65:7	Who stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.

946.text: Psalm 65:8	They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

947.text: Psalm 65:9	Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.

948.text: Psalm 65:10	Thou waterest the ridges of it abundantly: thou settlest the furrows of it: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing of it.

949.text: Psalm 65:11	Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.

950.text: Psalm 65:12	They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

951.text: Psalm 65:13	The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.

952.text: Psalm 66:1	To the chief Musician, A Song or Psalm. Make a joyful noise to God, all ye lands:

953.text: Psalm 66:2	Sing forth the honor of his name: make his praise glorious.

954.text: Psalm 66:3	Say to God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thy enemies submit themselves to thee.

955.text: Psalm 66:4	All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing to thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.

956.text: Psalm 66:5	Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing towards the children of men.

957.text: Psalm 66:6	He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there we rejoiced in him.

958.text: Psalm 66:7	He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.

959.text: Psalm 66:8	O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:

960.text: Psalm 66:9	Who holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.

961.text: Psalm 66:10	For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.

962.text: Psalm 66:11	Thou hast brought us into the net; thou hast laid affliction upon our loins.

963.text: Psalm 66:12	Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

964.text: Psalm 66:13	I will go into thy house with burnt-offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

965.text: Psalm 66:14	Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

966.text: Psalm 66:15	I will offer to thee burnt-sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.

967.text: Psalm 66:16	Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

968.text: Psalm 66:17	I cried to him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

969.text: Psalm 66:18	If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:

970.text: Psalm 66:19	But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

971.text: Psalm 66:20	Blessed be God, who hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.

972.text: Psalm 67:1	To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm or Song. God be merciful to us, and bless us; and cause his face to shine upon us. Selah.

973.text: Psalm 67:2	That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.

974.text: Psalm 67:3	Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.

975.text: Psalm 67:4	O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.

976.text: Psalm 67:5	Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.

977.text: Psalm 67:6	Then shall the earth yield her increase; and God, even our own God, will bless us.

978.text: Psalm 67:7	God will bless us, and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.

979.text: Psalm 68:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm or Song of David. Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.

980.text: Psalm 68:2	As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

981.text: Psalm 68:3	But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yes, let them exceedingly rejoice.

982.text: Psalm 68:4	Sing to God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.

983.text: Psalm 68:5	A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.

984.text: Psalm 68:6	God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those who are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.

985.text: Psalm 68:7	O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:

986.text: Psalm 68:8	The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

987.text: Psalm 68:9	Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, by which thou didst confirm thy inheritance, when it was weary.

988.text: Psalm 68:10	Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.

989.text: Psalm 68:11	The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.

990.text: Psalm 68:12	Kings of armies fled apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.

991.text: Psalm 68:13	Though ye have lain among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.

992.text: Psalm 68:14	When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.

993.text: Psalm 68:15	The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; a high hill as the hill of Bashan.

994.text: Psalm 68:16	Why leap ye, ye lofty hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yes, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.

995.text: Psalm 68:17	The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.

996.text: Psalm 68:18	Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yes, for the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell among them.

997.text: Psalm 68:19	Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.

998.text: Psalm 68:20	He that is our God is the God of salvation; and to GOD the Lord belong the issues from death.

999.text: Psalm 68:21	But God will wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such one as goeth on still in his trespasses.

1000.text: Psalm 68:22	The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea.

1001.text: Psalm 68:23	That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thy enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.

1002.text: Psalm 68:24	They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.

1003.text: Psalm 68:25	The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.

1004.text: Psalm 68:26	Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.

1005.text: Psalm 68:27	There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their counsel, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

1006.text: Psalm 68:28	Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.

1007.text: Psalm 68:29	Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents to thee.

1008.text: Psalm 68:30	Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one shall submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.

1009.text: Psalm 68:31	Princes shall come out of Egypt; Cush shall soon stretch out her hands to God.

1010.text: Psalm 68:32	Sing to God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises to the Lord; Selah:

1011.text: Psalm 68:33	To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.

1012.text: Psalm 68:34	Ascribe ye strength to God: his excellence is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

1013.text: Psalm 68:35	O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power to his people. Blessed be God.

1014.text: Psalm 69:1	To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, A Psalm of David. Save me, O God; for the waters are come in to my soul.

1015.text: Psalm 69:2	I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

1016.text: Psalm 69:3	I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: my eyes fail while I wait for my God.

1017.text: Psalm 69:4	They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head: they that would destroy me, being my enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.

1018.text: Psalm 69:5	O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

1019.text: Psalm 69:6	Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.

1020.text: Psalm 69:7	Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

1021.text: Psalm 69:8	I am become a stranger to my brethren, and an alien to my mother’s children.

1022.text: Psalm 69:9	For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee have fallen upon me.

1023.text: Psalm 69:10	When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

1024.text: Psalm 69:11	I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

1025.text: Psalm 69:12	They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.

1026.text: Psalm 69:13	But as for me, my prayer is to thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

1027.text: Psalm 69:14	Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

1028.text: Psalm 69:15	Let not the water-flood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

1029.text: Psalm 69:16	Hear me, O LORD; for thy loving-kindness is good: turn to me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

1030.text: Psalm 69:17	And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

1031.text: Psalm 69:18	Draw nigh to my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of my enemies.

1032.text: Psalm 69:19	Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonor: my adversaries are all before thee.

1033.text: Psalm 69:20	Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

1034.text: Psalm 69:21	They gave me also gall for my food; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

1035.text: Psalm 69:22	Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.

1036.text: Psalm 69:23	Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

1037.text: Psalm 69:24	Pour out thy indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

1038.text: Psalm 69:25	Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.

1039.text: Psalm 69:26	For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

1040.text: Psalm 69:27	Add iniquity to their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

1041.text: Psalm 69:28	Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

1042.text: Psalm 69:29	But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

1043.text: Psalm 69:30	I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

1044.text: Psalm 69:31	This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

1045.text: Psalm 69:32	The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.

1046.text: Psalm 69:33	For the LORD heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

1047.text: Psalm 69:34	Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

1048.text: Psalm 69:35	For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

1049.text: Psalm 69:36	The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

1050.text: Psalm 70:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David to bring to remembrance. Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O LORD.

1051.text: Psalm 70:2	Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.

1052.text: Psalm 70:3	Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.

1053.text: Psalm 70:4	Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.

1054.text: Psalm 70:5	But I am poor and needy: make haste to me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O LORD, make no delay.

1055.text: Psalm 71:1	In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.

1056.text: Psalm 71:2	Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thy ear to me, and save me.

1057.text: Psalm 71:3	Be thou my strong habitation, to which I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.

1058.text: Psalm 71:4	Deliver me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

1059.text: Psalm 71:5	For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD: thou art my trust from my youth.

1060.text: Psalm 71:6	By thee have I been sustained from my birth: thou art he that brought me into life: my praise shall be continually of thee.

1061.text: Psalm 71:7	I am as a wonder to many; but thou art my strong refuge.

1062.text: Psalm 71:8	Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honor all the day.

1063.text: Psalm 71:9	Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.

1064.text: Psalm 71:10	For my enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,

1065.text: Psalm 71:11	Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.

1066.text: Psalm 71:12	O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.

1067.text: Psalm 71:13	Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonor that seek my hurt.

1068.text: Psalm 71:14	But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.

1069.text: Psalm 71:15	My mouth shall show forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.

1070.text: Psalm 71:16	I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.

1071.text: Psalm 71:17	O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.

1072.text: Psalm 71:18	Now also when I am old and gray-headed, O God, forsake me not; until I have shown thy strength to this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.

1073.text: Psalm 71:19	Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like to thee!

1074.text: Psalm 71:20	Thou, who hast shown me great and severe troubles, wilt revive me again, and wilt bring me again from the depths of the earth.

1075.text: Psalm 71:21	Thou wilt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

1076.text: Psalm 71:22	I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: to thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.

1077.text: Psalm 71:23	My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing to thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.

1078.text: Psalm 71:24	My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought to shame, that seek my hurt.

1079.text: Psalm 72:1	A Psalm for Solomon. Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness to the king’s son.

1080.text: Psalm 72:2	He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.

1081.text: Psalm 72:3	The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.

1082.text: Psalm 72:4	He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.

1083.text: Psalm 72:5	They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.

1084.text: Psalm 72:6	He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.

1085.text: Psalm 72:7	In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.

1086.text: Psalm 72:8	He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.

1087.text: Psalm 72:9	They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.

1088.text: Psalm 72:10	The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

1089.text: Psalm 72:11	Yes, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.

1090.text: Psalm 72:12	For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.

1091.text: Psalm 72:13	He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.

1092.text: Psalm 72:14	He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall be their blood in his sight.

1093.text: Psalm 72:15	And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily shall he be praised.

1094.text: Psalm 72:16	There shall be a handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit of it shall shake like Lebanon: and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.

1095.text: Psalm 72:17	His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.

1096.text: Psalm 72:18	Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.

1097.text: Psalm 72:19	And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and amen.

1098.text: Psalm 72:20	The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

1099.text: Psalm 73:1	A Psalm of Asaph. Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

1100.text: Psalm 73:2	But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

1101.text: Psalm 73:3	For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

1102.text: Psalm 73:4	For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.

1103.text: Psalm 73:5	They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they afflicted like other men.

1104.text: Psalm 73:6	Therefore pride encompasseth them as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.

1105.text: Psalm 73:7	Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

1106.text: Psalm 73:8	They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.

1107.text: Psalm 73:9	They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

1108.text: Psalm 73:10	Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

1109.text: Psalm 73:11	And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the Most High?

1110.text: Psalm 73:12	Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

1111.text: Psalm 73:13	Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocence.

1112.text: Psalm 73:14	For all the day long have I been afflicted, and chastened every morning.

1113.text: Psalm 73:15	If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

1114.text: Psalm 73:16	When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

1115.text: Psalm 73:17	Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then I understood their end.

1116.text: Psalm 73:18	Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou didst cast them down into destruction.

1117.text: Psalm 73:19	How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

1118.text: Psalm 73:20	As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou wilt despise their image.

1119.text: Psalm 73:21	Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

1120.text: Psalm 73:22	So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.

1121.text: Psalm 73:23	Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast held me by my right hand.

1122.text: Psalm 73:24	Thou wilt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.

1123.text: Psalm 73:25	Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire besides thee.

1124.text: Psalm 73:26	My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

1125.text: Psalm 73:27	For lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go astray from thee.

1126.text: Psalm 73:28	But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.

1127.text: Psalm 74:1	Maschil of Asaph. O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thy anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

1128.text: Psalm 74:2	Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old: the rod of thy inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, in which thou hast dwelt.

1129.text: Psalm 74:3	Lift up thy feet to the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

1130.text: Psalm 74:4	Thy enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.

1131.text: Psalm 74:5	A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.

1132.text: Psalm 74:6	But now they break down the carved work of it at once with axes and hammers.

1133.text: Psalm 74:7	They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling-place of thy name to the ground.

1134.text: Psalm 74:8	They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.

1135.text: Psalm 74:9	We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.

1136.text: Psalm 74:10	O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?

1137.text: Psalm 74:11	Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.

1138.text: Psalm 74:12	For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

1139.text: Psalm 74:13	Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou didst break the heads of the dragons in the waters.

1140.text: Psalm 74:14	Thou didst break the head of leviathan in pieces, and didst give him to be food to the people inhabiting the wilderness.

1141.text: Psalm 74:15	Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou didst dry up mighty rivers.

1142.text: Psalm 74:16	The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

1143.text: Psalm 74:17	Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.

1144.text: Psalm 74:18	Remember this, the enemy hath reproached, O LORD, and the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.

1145.text: Psalm 74:19	O deliver not the soul of thy turtle dove to the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.

1146.text: Psalm 74:20	Have respect to the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.

1147.text: Psalm 74:21	O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.

1148.text: Psalm 74:22	Arise, O God, plead thy own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.

1149.text: Psalm 74:23	Forget not the voice of thy enemies: the tumult of those that rise against thee increaseth continually.

1150.text: Psalm 75:1	To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, A Psalm or Song of Asaph. To thee, O God, do we give thanks, to thee do we give thanks: for that thy name is near, thy wondrous works declare.

1151.text: Psalm 75:2	When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.

1152.text: Psalm 75:3	The earth and all its inhabitants are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.

1153.text: Psalm 75:4	I said to the fools, Deal not foolishly; and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:

1154.text: Psalm 75:5	Lift not up your horn on high: speak not with a stiff neck.

1155.text: Psalm 75:6	For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.

1156.text: Psalm 75:7	But God is the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

1157.text: Psalm 75:8	For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture, and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs of it all the wicked of the earth shall wring them out, and drink them.

1158.text: Psalm 75:9	But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

1159.text: Psalm 75:10	All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

1160.text: Psalm 76:1	To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm or Song of Asaph. In Judah is God known: his name is great in Israel.

1161.text: Psalm 76:2	In Salem also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in Zion.

1162.text: Psalm 76:3	There he broke the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.

1163.text: Psalm 76:4	Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.

1164.text: Psalm 76:5	The stout-hearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and none of the men of might have found their hands.

1165.text: Psalm 76:6	At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.

1166.text: Psalm 76:7	Thou, even thou, art to be feared: and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?

1167.text: Psalm 76:8	Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth feared, and was still,

1168.text: Psalm 76:9	When God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.

1169.text: Psalm 76:10	Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of wrath wilt thou restrain.

1170.text: Psalm 76:11	Vow, and pay to the LORD your God: let all that are about him bring presents to him that ought to be feared.

1171.text: Psalm 76:12	He shall cut off the spirit of princes: he is terrible to the kings of the earth.

1172.text: Psalm 77:1	To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of Asaph. I cried to God with my voice, even to God with my voice; and he gave ear to me.

1173.text: Psalm 77:2	In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

1174.text: Psalm 77:3	I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

1175.text: Psalm 77:4	Thou holdest my eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

1176.text: Psalm 77:5	I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

1177.text: Psalm 77:6	I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with my own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

1178.text: Psalm 77:7	Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favorable no more?

1179.text: Psalm 77:8	Is his mercy wholly gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?

1180.text: Psalm 77:9	Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

1181.text: Psalm 77:10	And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most High.

1182.text: Psalm 77:11	I will remember the works of the LORD: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

1183.text: Psalm 77:12	I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

1184.text: Psalm 77:13	Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God!

1185.text: Psalm 77:14	Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

1186.text: Psalm 77:15	Thou hast with thy arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

1187.text: Psalm 77:16	The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were disturbed.

1188.text: Psalm 77:17	The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thy arrows also went abroad.

1189.text: Psalm 77:18	The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

1190.text: Psalm 77:19	Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

1191.text: Psalm 77:20	Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

1192.text: Psalm 78:1	Maschil of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ear to the words of my mouth.

1193.text: Psalm 78:2	I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

1194.text: Psalm 78:3	Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

1195.text: Psalm 78:4	We will not hide them from their children, showing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

1196.text: Psalm 78:5	For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

1197.text: Psalm 78:6	That the generation to come might know them, even the children who should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:

1198.text: Psalm 78:7	That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

1199.text: Psalm 78:8	And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not steadfast with God.

1200.text: Psalm 78:9	The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

1201.text: Psalm 78:10	They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

1202.text: Psalm 78:11	And forgot his works, and his wonders that he had shown them.

1203.text: Psalm 78:12	Marvelous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

1204.text: Psalm 78:13	He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as a heap.

1205.text: Psalm 78:14	In the day-time also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

1206.text: Psalm 78:15	He cleaved the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

1207.text: Psalm 78:16	He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

1208.text: Psalm 78:17	And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the Most High in the wilderness.

1209.text: Psalm 78:18	And they tempted God in their heart by asking food for their desire.

1210.text: Psalm 78:19	Yes, they spoke against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

1211.text: Psalm 78:20	Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

1212.text: Psalm 78:21	Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

1213.text: Psalm 78:22	Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

1214.text: Psalm 78:23	Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

1215.text: Psalm 78:24	And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

1216.text: Psalm 78:25	Man ate angels’ food: he sent them food to the full.

1217.text: Psalm 78:26	He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

1218.text: Psalm 78:27	He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

1219.text: Psalm 78:28	And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, around their habitations.

1220.text: Psalm 78:29	So they ate, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

1221.text: Psalm 78:30	They were not estranged from their desire: but while their meat was yet in their mouths,

1222.text: Psalm 78:31	The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

1223.text: Psalm 78:32	For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

1224.text: Psalm 78:33	Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

1225.text: Psalm 78:34	When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and inquired early after God.

1226.text: Psalm 78:35	And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

1227.text: Psalm 78:36	Nevertheless they flattered him with their mouth, and they lied to him with their tongues.

1228.text: Psalm 78:37	For their heart was not right with him, neither were they steadfast in his covenant.

1229.text: Psalm 78:38	But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yes, many a time he turned his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

1230.text: Psalm 78:39	For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

1231.text: Psalm 78:40	How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

1232.text: Psalm 78:41	Yes, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

1233.text: Psalm 78:42	They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

1234.text: Psalm 78:43	How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

1235.text: Psalm 78:44	And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

1236.text: Psalm 78:45	He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

1237.text: Psalm 78:46	He gave also their increase to the caterpillar, and their labor to the locust.

1238.text: Psalm 78:47	He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with frost.

1239.text: Psalm 78:48	He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

1240.text: Psalm 78:49	He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.

1241.text: Psalm 78:50	He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

1242.text: Psalm 78:51	And smote all the first-born in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

1243.text: Psalm 78:52	But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

1244.text: Psalm 78:53	And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

1245.text: Psalm 78:54	And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

1246.text: Psalm 78:55	He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

1247.text: Psalm 78:56	Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

1248.text: Psalm 78:57	But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

1249.text: Psalm 78:58	For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

1250.text: Psalm 78:59	When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

1251.text: Psalm 78:60	So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

1252.text: Psalm 78:61	And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

1253.text: Psalm 78:62	He gave over his people also to the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

1254.text: Psalm 78:63	The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

1255.text: Psalm 78:64	Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

1256.text: Psalm 78:65	Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

1257.text: Psalm 78:66	And he smote his enemies in the hinder part: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

1258.text: Psalm 78:67	Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

1259.text: Psalm 78:68	But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

1260.text: Psalm 78:69	And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

1261.text: Psalm 78:70	He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheep-folds:

1262.text: Psalm 78:71	From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

1263.text: Psalm 78:72	So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.

1264.text: Psalm 79:1	A Psalm of Asaph. O God, the heathen have come into thy inheritance; thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem on heaps.

1265.text: Psalm 79:2	The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be food to the fowls of the heaven, the flesh of thy saints, to the beasts of the earth.

1266.text: Psalm 79:3	Their blood have they shed like water around Jerusalem; and there was none to bury them.

1267.text: Psalm 79:4	We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and derision to them that are around us.

1268.text: Psalm 79:5	How long, LORD? wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?

1269.text: Psalm 79:6	Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.

1270.text: Psalm 79:7	For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his dwelling-place.

1271.text: Psalm 79:8	O remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender mercies speedily succor us: for we are brought very low.

1272.text: Psalm 79:9	Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name: and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name’s sake.

1273.text: Psalm 79:10	Why should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by avenging the blood of thy servants which is shed.

1274.text: Psalm 79:11	Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to die;

1275.text: Psalm 79:12	And render to our neighbors seven-fold into their bosom their reproach, with which they have reproached thee, O Lord.

1276.text: Psalm 79:13	So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever: we will show forth thy praise to all generations.

1277.text: Psalm 80:1	To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim Eduth, A Psalm of Asaph. Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubim, shine forth.

1278.text: Psalm 80:2	Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come and save us.

1279.text: Psalm 80:3	Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

1280.text: Psalm 80:4	O LORD God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?

1281.text: Psalm 80:5	Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears to drink in great measure.

1282.text: Psalm 80:6	Thou makest us a strife to our neighbors: and our enemies laugh among themselves.

1283.text: Psalm 80:7	Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

1284.text: Psalm 80:8	Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.

1285.text: Psalm 80:9	Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.

1286.text: Psalm 80:10	The hills were covered with the shade of it, and its boughs were like the goodly cedars.

1287.text: Psalm 80:11	She sent out her boughs to the sea, and her branches to the river.

1288.text: Psalm 80:12	Why hast thou then broke down her hedges, so that all they who pass by the way do pluck her?

1289.text: Psalm 80:13	The boar from the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.

1290.text: Psalm 80:14	Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;

1291.text: Psalm 80:15	And the vineyard which thy right hand planted, and the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.

1292.text: Psalm 80:16	It is burnt with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

1293.text: Psalm 80:17	Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.

1294.text: Psalm 80:18	So will we not go back from thee: revive us, and we will call upon thy name.

1295.text: Psalm 80:19	Turn us again, O LORD God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

1296.text: Psalm 81:1	To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm of Asaph. Sing aloud to God our strength: make a joyful noise to the God of Jacob.

1297.text: Psalm 81:2	Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.

1298.text: Psalm 81:3	Blow the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.

1299.text: Psalm 81:4	For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.

1300.text: Psalm 81:5	This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.

1301.text: Psalm 81:6	I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.

1302.text: Psalm 81:7	Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

1303.text: Psalm 81:8	Hear, O my people, and I will testify to thee; O Israel, if thou wilt hearken to me;

1304.text: Psalm 81:9	There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.

1305.text: Psalm 81:10	I am the LORD thy God who brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

1306.text: Psalm 81:11	But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would not obey me.

1307.text: Psalm 81:12	So I gave them up to their own hearts lust: and they walked in their own counsels.

1308.text: Psalm 81:13	O that my people had hearkened to me, and Israel had walked in my ways!

1309.text: Psalm 81:14	I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

1310.text: Psalm 81:15	The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves to him: and their time should have endured for ever.

1311.text: Psalm 81:16	He would have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock I should have satisfied thee.

1312.text: Psalm 82:1	A Psalm of Asaph. God standeth in the congregation of the mighty; he judgeth among the gods.

1313.text: Psalm 82:2	How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.

1314.text: Psalm 82:3	Defend the poor and fatherless: do justice to the afflicted and needy.

1315.text: Psalm 82:4	Deliver the poor and needy: deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
