1316.text: Psalm 82:5	They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

1317.text: Psalm 82:6	I have said, Ye are gods; and all of you are children of the Most High.

1318.text: Psalm 82:7	But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.

1319.text: Psalm 82:8	Arise, O God, judge the earth: for thou wilt inherit all nations.

1320.text: Psalm 83:1	A song, or Psalm of Asaph. Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.

1321.text: Psalm 83:2	For lo, thy enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

1322.text: Psalm 83:3	They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.

1323.text: Psalm 83:4	They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

1324.text: Psalm 83:5	For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee,

1325.text: Psalm 83:6	The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;

1326.text: Psalm 83:7	Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;

1327.text: Psalm 83:8	Assur also is joined with them: they have helped the children of Lot. Selah.

1328.text: Psalm 83:9	Do to them as to the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:

1329.text: Psalm 83:10	Who perished at En-dor: they became as dung for the earth.

1330.text: Psalm 83:11	Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yes, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:

1331.text: Psalm 83:12	Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.

1332.text: Psalm 83:13	O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.

1333.text: Psalm 83:14	As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;

1334.text: Psalm 83:15	So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.

1335.text: Psalm 83:16	Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O LORD.

1336.text: Psalm 83:17	Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yes, let them be put to shame, and perish:

1337.text: Psalm 83:18	That men may know that thou, whose name alone is JEHOVAH, art the most high over all the earth.

1338.text: Psalm 84:1	To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. How amiable are thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!

1339.text: Psalm 84:2	My soul longeth, and even fainteth for the courts of the LORD: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.

1340.text: Psalm 84:3	Yes, the sparrow hath found a house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thy altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God.

1341.text: Psalm 84:4	Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.

1342.text: Psalm 84:5	Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.

1343.text: Psalm 84:6	Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.

1344.text: Psalm 84:7	They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.

1345.text: Psalm 84:8	O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

1346.text: Psalm 84:9	Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thy anointed.

1347.text: Psalm 84:10	For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

1348.text: Psalm 84:11	For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

1349.text: Psalm 84:12	O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.

1350.text: Psalm 85:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. LORD, thou hast been favorable to thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.

1351.text: Psalm 85:2	Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.

1352.text: Psalm 85:3	Thou hast taken away all thy wrath; thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thy anger.

1353.text: Psalm 85:4	Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thy anger towards us to cease.

1354.text: Psalm 85:5	Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thy anger to all generations?

1355.text: Psalm 85:6	Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

1356.text: Psalm 85:7	Show us thy mercy, O LORD, and grant us thy salvation.

1357.text: Psalm 85:8	I will hear what God the LORD will speak: for he will speak peace to his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.

1358.text: Psalm 85:9	Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.

1359.text: Psalm 85:10	Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

1360.text: Psalm 85:11	Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

1361.text: Psalm 85:12	Yes, the LORD will give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase.

1362.text: Psalm 85:13	Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set us in the way of his steps.

1363.text: Psalm 86:1	A Prayer of David. Bow down thy ear, O LORD, hear me: for I am poor and needy.

1364.text: Psalm 86:2	Preserve my soul; for I am holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.

1365.text: Psalm 86:3	Be merciful to me, O Lord: for I cry to thee daily.

1366.text: Psalm 86:4	Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for to thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

1367.text: Psalm 86:5	For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and abundant in mercy to all them that call upon thee.

1368.text: Psalm 86:6	Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.

1369.text: Psalm 86:7	In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.

1370.text: Psalm 86:8	Among the gods there is none like thee, O Lord; neither are there any works like thy works.

1371.text: Psalm 86:9	All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.

1372.text: Psalm 86:10	For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.

1373.text: Psalm 86:11	Teach me thy way, O LORD; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.

1374.text: Psalm 86:12	I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.

1375.text: Psalm 86:13	For great is thy mercy towards me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.

1376.text: Psalm 86:14	O God, the proud have risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.

1377.text: Psalm 86:15	But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious; long-suffering, and abundant in mercy and truth.

1378.text: Psalm 86:16	O turn to me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength to thy servant, and save the son of thy handmaid.

1379.text: Psalm 86:17	Show me a token for good; that they who hate me may see it, and be ashamed: because thou, LORD, hast helped me, and comforted me.

1380.text: Psalm 87:1	A Psalm or Song for the sons of Korah. His foundation is in the holy mountains.

1381.text: Psalm 87:2	The LORD loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

1382.text: Psalm 87:3	Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.

1383.text: Psalm 87:4	I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to them that know me: behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Cush; this man was born there.

1384.text: Psalm 87:5	And of Zion it shall be said, This and that man was born in her: and the Highest himself shall establish her.

1385.text: Psalm 87:6	The LORD shall count, when he writeth up the people, that this man was born there. Selah.

1386.text: Psalm 87:7	As well the singers as the players on instruments shall be there: all my springs are in thee.

1387.text: Psalm 88:1	A Song or Psalm for the sons of Korah, to the chief Musician upon Mahalath Leannoth, Maschil of Heman the Ezrahite. O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:

1388.text: Psalm 88:2	Let my prayer come before thee: incline thy ear to my cry;

1389.text: Psalm 88:3	For my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh to the grave.

1390.text: Psalm 88:4	I am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man that hath no strength:

1391.text: Psalm 88:5	Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.

1392.text: Psalm 88:6	Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.

1393.text: Psalm 88:7	Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.

1394.text: Psalm 88:8	Thou hast put away my acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination to them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

1395.text: Psalm 88:9	My eye mourneth by reason of affliction: LORD, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands to thee.

1396.text: Psalm 88:10	Wilt thou show wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.

1397.text: Psalm 88:11	Shall thy loving-kindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?

1398.text: Psalm 88:12	Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

1399.text: Psalm 88:13	But to thee have I cried, O LORD; and in the morning shall my prayer come before thee.

1400.text: Psalm 88:14	LORD, why castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?

1401.text: Psalm 88:15	I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.

1402.text: Psalm 88:16	Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.

1403.text: Psalm 88:17	They came around me daily like water; they encompassed me together.

1404.text: Psalm 88:18	Lover and friend hast thou put far from me, and my acquaintance into darkness.

1405.text: Psalm 89:1	Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite. I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

1406.text: Psalm 89:2	For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness wilt thou establish in the very heavens.

1407.text: Psalm 89:3	I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn to David my servant,

1408.text: Psalm 89:4	Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

1409.text: Psalm 89:5	And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD; thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

1410.text: Psalm 89:6	For who in the heaven can be compared to the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened to the LORD?

1411.text: Psalm 89:7	God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence by all them that are about him.

1412.text: Psalm 89:8	O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like to thee? or to thy faithfulness around thee?

1413.text: Psalm 89:9	Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when its waves arise, thou stillest them.

1414.text: Psalm 89:10	Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thy enemies with thy strong arm.

1415.text: Psalm 89:11	The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world, and the fullness of it, thou hast founded them.

1416.text: Psalm 89:12	The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.

1417.text: Psalm 89:13	Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

1418.text: Psalm 89:14	Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

1419.text: Psalm 89:15	Blessed are the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.

1420.text: Psalm 89:16	In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

1421.text: Psalm 89:17	For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favor our horn shall be exalted.

1422.text: Psalm 89:18	For the LORD is our defense; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

1423.text: Psalm 89:19	Then thou didst speak in vision to thy holy one, and say, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

1424.text: Psalm 89:20	I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

1425.text: Psalm 89:21	With whom my hand shall be established: my arm also shall strengthen him.

1426.text: Psalm 89:22	The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

1427.text: Psalm 89:23	And I will beat down his foes before his face, and afflict them that hate him.

1428.text: Psalm 89:24	But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

1429.text: Psalm 89:25	I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

1430.text: Psalm 89:26	He shall cry to me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

1431.text: Psalm 89:27	Also I will make him my first-born, higher than the kings of the earth.

1432.text: Psalm 89:28	My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

1433.text: Psalm 89:29	His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

1434.text: Psalm 89:30	If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

1435.text: Psalm 89:31	If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

1436.text: Psalm 89:32	Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

1437.text: Psalm 89:33	Nevertheless my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

1438.text: Psalm 89:34	My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that hath gone out of my lips.

1439.text: Psalm 89:35	Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie to David.

1440.text: Psalm 89:36	His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

1441.text: Psalm 89:37	It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

1442.text: Psalm 89:38	But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thy anointed.

1443.text: Psalm 89:39	Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

1444.text: Psalm 89:40	Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

1445.text: Psalm 89:41	All that pass by the way plunder him: he is a reproach to his neighbors.

1446.text: Psalm 89:42	Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

1447.text: Psalm 89:43	Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

1448.text: Psalm 89:44	Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

1449.text: Psalm 89:45	The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

1450.text: Psalm 89:46	How long, LORD, wilt thou hide thyself? for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

1451.text: Psalm 89:47	Remember how short my time is: why hast thou made all men in vain?

1452.text: Psalm 89:48	What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

1453.text: Psalm 89:49	Lord, where are thy former loving-kindnesses, which thou didst swear to David in thy truth?

1454.text: Psalm 89:50	Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;

1455.text: Psalm 89:51	With which thy enemies have reproached, O LORD; with which they have reproached the footsteps of thy anointed

1456.text: Psalm 89:52	Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen and amen.

1457.text: Psalm 90:1	A prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place in all generations.

1458.text: Psalm 90:2	Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.

1459.text: Psalm 90:3	Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.

1460.text: Psalm 90:4	For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.

1461.text: Psalm 90:5	Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep; in the morning they are like grass which groweth.

1462.text: Psalm 90:6	In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.

1463.text: Psalm 90:7	For we are consumed by thy anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.

1464.text: Psalm 90:8	Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.

1465.text: Psalm 90:9	For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years, as a tale that is told.

1466.text: Psalm 90:10	The days of our years are seventy years; and if by reason of strength they are eighty years, yet is their strength labor and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.

1467.text: Psalm 90:11	Who knoweth the power of thy anger? even according to thy fear, so is thy wrath.

1468.text: Psalm 90:12	So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts to wisdom.

1469.text: Psalm 90:13	Return, O LORD, how long? and repent thou concerning thy servants.

1470.text: Psalm 90:14	O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

1471.text: Psalm 90:15	Make us glad according to the days in which thou hast afflicted us, and the years in which we have seen evil.

1472.text: Psalm 90:16	Let thy work appear to thy servants, and thy glory to their children.

1473.text: Psalm 90:17	And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yes, the work of our hands establish thou it.

1474.text: Psalm 91:1	He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

1475.text: Psalm 91:2	I will say of the LORD, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.

1476.text: Psalm 91:3	Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.

1477.text: Psalm 91:4	He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.

1478.text: Psalm 91:5	Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

1479.text: Psalm 91:6	Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness; nor for the destruction that wasteth at noon-day.

1480.text: Psalm 91:7	A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.

1481.text: Psalm 91:8	Only with thy eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.

1482.text: Psalm 91:9	Because thou hast made the LORD who is my refuge, even the Most High, thy habitation;

1483.text: Psalm 91:10	There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

1484.text: Psalm 91:11	For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

1485.text: Psalm 91:12	They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

1486.text: Psalm 91:13	Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.

1487.text: Psalm 91:14	Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.

1488.text: Psalm 91:15	He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honor him.

1489.text: Psalm 91:16	With long life will I satisfy him, and show him my salvation.

1490.text: Psalm 92:1	A Psalm or Song for the sabbath day. It is a good thing to give thanks to the LORD, and to sing praises to thy name, O Most High.

1491.text: Psalm 92:2	To show forth thy loving-kindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night.

1492.text: Psalm 92:3	Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.

1493.text: Psalm 92:4	For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

1494.text: Psalm 92:5	O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.

1495.text: Psalm 92:6	A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

1496.text: Psalm 92:7	When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:

1497.text: Psalm 92:8	But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.

1498.text: Psalm 92:9	For lo, thy enemies, O LORD, for lo, thy enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

1499.text: Psalm 92:10	But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

1500.text: Psalm 92:11	My eye also shall see my desire on my enemies, and my ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.

1501.text: Psalm 92:12	The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree; he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

1502.text: Psalm 92:13	Those that are planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.

1503.text: Psalm 92:14	They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;

1504.text: Psalm 92:15	To show that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

1505.text: Psalm 93:1	The LORD reigneth, he is clothed with majesty; the LORD is clothed with strength, with which he hath girded himself: the world also is established, that it cannot be moved.

1506.text: Psalm 93:2	Thy throne is established of old: thou art from everlasting.

1507.text: Psalm 93:3	The floods have lifted up, O LORD, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift their waves.

1508.text: Psalm 93:4	The LORD on high is mightier than the noise of many waters, yes, than the mighty waves of the sea.

1509.text: Psalm 93:5	Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thy house, O LORD, for ever.

1510.text: Psalm 94:1	O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, show thyself.

1511.text: Psalm 94:2	Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.

1512.text: Psalm 94:3	LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?

1513.text: Psalm 94:4	How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

1514.text: Psalm 94:5	They break in pieces thy people, O LORD, and afflict thy heritage.

1515.text: Psalm 94:6	They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

1516.text: Psalm 94:7	Yet they say, The LORD will not see, neither will the God of Jacob regard it.

1517.text: Psalm 94:8	Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?

1518.text: Psalm 94:9	He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?

1519.text: Psalm 94:10	He that chastiseth the heathen, shall he not correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall he not know?

1520.text: Psalm 94:11	The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

1521.text: Psalm 94:12	Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;

1522.text: Psalm 94:13	That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

1523.text: Psalm 94:14	For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

1524.text: Psalm 94:15	But judgment shall return to righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

1525.text: Psalm 94:16	Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

1526.text: Psalm 94:17	Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

1527.text: Psalm 94:18	When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.

1528.text: Psalm 94:19	In the multitude of my thoughts within me, thy comforts delight my soul.

1529.text: Psalm 94:20	Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

1530.text: Psalm 94:21	They assemble themselves against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

1531.text: Psalm 94:22	But the LORD is my defense; and my God is the rock of my refuge.

1532.text: Psalm 94:23	And he will bring upon them their own iniquity, and will cut them off in their own wickedness; yes, the LORD our God will cut them off.

1533.text: Psalm 95:1	O come, let us sing to the LORD: let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.

1534.text: Psalm 95:2	Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise to him with psalms.

1535.text: Psalm 95:3	For the LORD is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

1536.text: Psalm 95:4	In his hand are the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills is his also.

1537.text: Psalm 95:5	The sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.

1538.text: Psalm 95:6	O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the LORD our maker.

1539.text: Psalm 95:7	For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To-day, if ye will hear his voice,

1540.text: Psalm 95:8	Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

1541.text: Psalm 95:9	When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.

1542.text: Psalm 95:10	Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:

1543.text: Psalm 95:11	To whom I swore in my wrath, that they should not enter into my rest.

1544.text: Psalm 96:1	O sing to the LORD a new song: sing to the LORD, all the earth.

1545.text: Psalm 96:2	Sing to the LORD, bless his name; show forth his salvation from day to day.

1546.text: Psalm 96:3	Declare his glory among the heathen, his wonders among all people.

1547.text: Psalm 96:4	For the LORD is great, and greatly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.

1548.text: Psalm 96:5	For all the gods of the nations are idols: but the LORD made the heavens.

1549.text: Psalm 96:6	Honor and majesty are before him: strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

1550.text: Psalm 96:7	Give to the LORD, O ye kindreds of the people, give to the LORD glory and strength.

1551.text: Psalm 96:8	Give to the LORD the glory due to his name: bring an offering, and come into his courts.

1552.text: Psalm 96:9	O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.

1553.text: Psalm 96:10	Say among the heathen that the LORD reigneth: the world also shall be established that it shall not be moved: he will judge the people righteously.

1554.text: Psalm 96:11	Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fullness of it.

1555.text: Psalm 96:12	Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the LORD:

1556.text: Psalm 96:13	For he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he will judge the world with righteousness, and the people with his truth.

1557.text: Psalm 97:1	The LORD reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad.

1558.text: Psalm 97:2	Clouds and darkness surround him: righteousness and judgment are the habitation of his throne.

1559.text: Psalm 97:3	A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.

1560.text: Psalm 97:4	His lightnings enlightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.

1561.text: Psalm 97:5	The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

1562.text: Psalm 97:6	The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.

1563.text: Psalm 97:7	Confounded be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols; worship him, all ye gods.

1564.text: Psalm 97:8	Zion heard, and was glad; and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments, O LORD.

1565.text: Psalm 97:9	For thou, LORD, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.

1566.text: Psalm 97:10	Ye that love the LORD, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.

1567.text: Psalm 97:11	Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.

1568.text: Psalm 97:12	Rejoice in the LORD, ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

1569.text: Psalm 98:1	A Psalm. O sing to the LORD a new song; for he hath done marvelous things: his right hand, and his holy arm, hath gotten him the victory.

1570.text: Psalm 98:2	The LORD hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shown in the sight of the heathen.

1571.text: Psalm 98:3	He hath remembered his mercy and his truth towards the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

1572.text: Psalm 98:4	Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all the earth: make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.

1573.text: Psalm 98:5	Sing to the LORD with the harp; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.

1574.text: Psalm 98:6	With trumpets and sound of cornet make a joyful noise before the LORD, the King.

1575.text: Psalm 98:7	Let the sea roar, and the fullness of it, the world, and they that dwell therein.

1576.text: Psalm 98:8	Let the floods clap their hands: let the hills be joyful together

1577.text: Psalm 98:9	Before the LORD; for he cometh to judge the earth: with righteousness will he judge the world, and the people with equity.

1578.text: Psalm 99:1	The LORD reigneth; let the people tremble: he setteth between the cherubim; let the earth be moved.

1579.text: Psalm 99:2	The LORD is great in Zion; and he is high above all people.

1580.text: Psalm 99:3	Let them praise thy great and terrible name; for it is holy.

1581.text: Psalm 99:4	The king’s strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

1582.text: Psalm 99:5	Exalt ye the LORD our God, and worship at his footstool; for he is holy.

1583.text: Psalm 99:6	Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name; they called upon the LORD, and he answered them.

1584.text: Psalm 99:7	He spoke to them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the ordinance that he gave them.

1585.text: Psalm 99:8	Thou didst answer them, O LORD our God: thou wast a God that forgavest them, though thou tookest vengeance of their inventions.

1586.text: Psalm 99:9	Exalt the LORD our God, and worship at his holy hill; for the LORD our God is holy.

1587.text: Psalm 100:1	A Psalm of praise. Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all ye lands.

1588.text: Psalm 100:2	Serve the LORD with gladness: come before his presence with singing.

1589.text: Psalm 100:3	Know ye that the LORD he is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

1590.text: Psalm 100:4	Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful to him, and bless his name.

1591.text: Psalm 100:5	For the LORD is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.

1592.text: Psalm 101:1	A Psalm of David. I will sing of mercy and judgment: to thee, O LORD, will I sing.

1593.text: Psalm 101:2	I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt thou come to me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.

1594.text: Psalm 101:3	I will set no wicked thing before my eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.

1595.text: Psalm 101:4	A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked person.

1596.text: Psalm 101:5	Whoever privily slandereth his neighbor, him will I cut off: him that hath a high look and a proud heart I will not suffer.

1597.text: Psalm 101:6	My eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.

1598.text: Psalm 101:7	He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

1599.text: Psalm 101:8	I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; that I may cut off all who practice wickedness from the city of the LORD.

1600.text: Psalm 102:1	A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed, and poureth out his complaint before the LORD. Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come to thee.

1601.text: Psalm 102:2	Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thy ear to me: in the day when I call, answer me speedily.

1602.text: Psalm 102:3	For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.

1603.text: Psalm 102:4	My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.

1604.text: Psalm 102:5	By reason of the voice of my groaning, my bones cleave to my skin.

1605.text: Psalm 102:6	I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.

1606.text: Psalm 102:7	I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.

1607.text: Psalm 102:8	My enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are enraged against me are sworn against me.

1608.text: Psalm 102:9	For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,

1609.text: Psalm 102:10	Because of thy indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

1610.text: Psalm 102:11	My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.

1611.text: Psalm 102:12	But thou, O LORD, shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance to all generations.

1612.text: Psalm 102:13	Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favor her, yes, the set time, is come.

1613.text: Psalm 102:14	For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favor the dust thereof.

1614.text: Psalm 102:15	So the heathen shall fear the name of the LORD: and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

1615.text: Psalm 102:16	When the LORD shall build up Zion, he will appear in his glory.

1616.text: Psalm 102:17	He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

1617.text: Psalm 102:18	This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.

1618.text: Psalm 102:19	For he hath looked down from the hight of his sanctuary; from heaven hath the LORD beheld the earth;

1619.text: Psalm 102:20	To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;

1620.text: Psalm 102:21	To declare the name of the LORD in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;

1621.text: Psalm 102:22	When the people are assembled, and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.

1622.text: Psalm 102:23	He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.

1623.text: Psalm 102:24	I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.

1624.text: Psalm 102:25	Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

1625.text: Psalm 102:26	They shall perish, but thou wilt endure: yes, all of them shall grow old like a garment; as a vesture wilt thou change them, and they shall be changed:

1626.text: Psalm 102:27	But thou art the same, and thy years will have no end.

1627.text: Psalm 102:28	The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.

1628.text: Psalm 103:1	A Psalm of David. Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.

1629.text: Psalm 103:2	Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

1630.text: Psalm 103:3	Who forgiveth all thy iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;

1631.text: Psalm 103:4	Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with loving-kindness and tender mercies;

1632.text: Psalm 103:5	Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

1633.text: Psalm 103:6	The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

1634.text: Psalm 103:7	He made known his ways to Moses, his acts to the children of Israel.

1635.text: Psalm 103:8	The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in mercy.

1636.text: Psalm 103:9	He will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

1637.text: Psalm 103:10	He hath not dealt with us according to our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

1638.text: Psalm 103:11	For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy towards them that fear him.

1639.text: Psalm 103:12	As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

1640.text: Psalm 103:13	Like as a father pitieth his children, so the LORD pitieth them that fear him.

1641.text: Psalm 103:14	For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.

1642.text: Psalm 103:15	As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

1643.text: Psalm 103:16	For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and its place shall know it no more.

1644.text: Psalm 103:17	But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness to children’s children;

1645.text: Psalm 103:18	To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.

1646.text: Psalm 103:19	The LORD hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.

1647.text: Psalm 103:20	Bless the LORD, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening to the voice of his word.

1648.text: Psalm 103:21	Bless ye the LORD, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.

1649.text: Psalm 103:22	Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.

1650.text: Psalm 104:1	Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honor and majesty.

1651.text: Psalm 104:2	Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:

1652.text: Psalm 104:3	Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:

1653.text: Psalm 104:4	Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:

1654.text: Psalm 104:5	Who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be removed for ever.

1655.text: Psalm 104:6	Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.

1656.text: Psalm 104:7	At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.

1657.text: Psalm 104:8	They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys to the place which thou hast founded for them.

1658.text: Psalm 104:9	Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.

1659.text: Psalm 104:10	He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.

1660.text: Psalm 104:11	They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.

1661.text: Psalm 104:12	By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.

1662.text: Psalm 104:13	He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

1663.text: Psalm 104:14	He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

1664.text: Psalm 104:15	And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man’s heart.

1665.text: Psalm 104:16	The trees of the LORD are full of sap; the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;

1666.text: Psalm 104:17	Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir-trees are her house.

1667.text: Psalm 104:18	The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.

1668.text: Psalm 104:19	He appointeth the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

1669.text: Psalm 104:20	Thou makest darkness, and it is night: in which all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.

1670.text: Psalm 104:21	The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their food from God.

1671.text: Psalm 104:22	The sun ariseth, they collect, and lay themselves down in their dens.

1672.text: Psalm 104:23	Man goeth forth to his work and to his labor until the evening.

1673.text: Psalm 104:24	O LORD, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

1674.text: Psalm 104:25	So is this great and wide sea, in which are creeping animals innumerable, both small and great beasts.

1675.text: Psalm 104:26	There go the ships: there is that leviathan, which thou hast made to play therein.

1676.text: Psalm 104:27	These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their food in due season.

1677.text: Psalm 104:28	That which thou givest them, they gather: thou openest thy hand, they are filled with good.

1678.text: Psalm 104:29	Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

1679.text: Psalm 104:30	Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.

1680.text: Psalm 104:31	The glory of the LORD shall endure for ever: the LORD shall rejoice in his works.

1681.text: Psalm 104:32	He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

1682.text: Psalm 104:33	I will sing to the LORD as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

1683.text: Psalm 104:34	My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the LORD.

1684.text: Psalm 104:35	Let sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the LORD, O my soul. Praise ye the LORD.

1685.text: Psalm 105:1	O give thanks to the LORD; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

1686.text: Psalm 105:2	Sing to him, sing psalms to him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

1687.text: Psalm 105:3	Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

1688.text: Psalm 105:4	Seek the LORD, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

1689.text: Psalm 105:5	Remember his wonderful works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

1690.text: Psalm 105:6	O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

1691.text: Psalm 105:7	He is the LORD our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

1692.text: Psalm 105:8	He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

1693.text: Psalm 105:9	Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath to Isaac;

1694.text: Psalm 105:10	And confirmed the same to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:

1695.text: Psalm 105:11	Saying, To thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

1696.text: Psalm 105:12	When they were a few men in number; yes, very few, and strangers in it.

1697.text: Psalm 105:13	When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;

1698.text: Psalm 105:14	He suffered no man to do them wrong: yes, he reproved kings for their sakes;

1699.text: Psalm 105:15	Saying, Touch not my anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

1700.text: Psalm 105:16	Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he broke the whole staff of bread.

1701.text: Psalm 105:17	He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

1702.text: Psalm 105:18	Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

1703.text: Psalm 105:19	Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.

1704.text: Psalm 105:20	The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

1705.text: Psalm 105:21	He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

1706.text: Psalm 105:22	To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

1707.text: Psalm 105:23	Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

1708.text: Psalm 105:24	And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

1709.text: Psalm 105:25	He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

1710.text: Psalm 105:26	He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.

1711.text: Psalm 105:27	They showed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

1712.text: Psalm 105:28	He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

1713.text: Psalm 105:29	He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

1714.text: Psalm 105:30	Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

1715.text: Psalm 105:31	He spoke, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their borders.

1716.text: Psalm 105:32	He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

1717.text: Psalm 105:33	He smote their vines also and their fig-trees; and broke the trees of their borders.

1718.text: Psalm 105:34	He spoke, and the locusts came, and caterpillars, and that without number,

1719.text: Psalm 105:35	And ate up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

1720.text: Psalm 105:36	He smote also all the first-born in their land, the chief of all their strength.

1721.text: Psalm 105:37	He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

1722.text: Psalm 105:38	Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

1723.text: Psalm 105:39	He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

1724.text: Psalm 105:40	The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

1725.text: Psalm 105:41	He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.

1726.text: Psalm 105:42	For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.

1727.text: Psalm 105:43	And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:

1728.text: Psalm 105:44	And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labor of the people;

1729.text: Psalm 105:45	That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the LORD.

1730.text: Psalm 106:1	Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks to the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

1731.text: Psalm 106:2	Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can show forth all his praise?

1732.text: Psalm 106:3	Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

1733.text: Psalm 106:4	Remember me, O LORD, with the favor that thou bearest to thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

1734.text: Psalm 106:5	That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thy inheritance.

1735.text: Psalm 106:6	We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

1736.text: Psalm 106:7	Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

1737.text: Psalm 106:8	Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

1738.text: Psalm 106:9	He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

1739.text: Psalm 106:10	And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

1740.text: Psalm 106:11	And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

1741.text: Psalm 106:12	Then they believed his words; they sang his praise.

1742.text: Psalm 106:13	They soon forgot his works; they waited not for his counsel:

1743.text: Psalm 106:14	But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

1744.text: Psalm 106:15	And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

1745.text: Psalm 106:16	They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.

1746.text: Psalm 106:17	The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

1747.text: Psalm 106:18	And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

1748.text: Psalm 106:19	They made a calf in Horeb, and worshiped the molten image.

1749.text: Psalm 106:20	Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

1750.text: Psalm 106:21	They forgot God their savior, who had done great things in Egypt;

1751.text: Psalm 106:22	Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

1752.text: Psalm 106:23	Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

1753.text: Psalm 106:24	Yes, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

1754.text: Psalm 106:25	But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not to the voice of the LORD.

1755.text: Psalm 106:26	Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

1756.text: Psalm 106:27	To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

1757.text: Psalm 106:28	They joined themselves also to Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

1758.text: Psalm 106:29	Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague broke in upon them.

1759.text: Psalm 106:30	Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

1760.text: Psalm 106:31	And that was counted to him for righteousness to all generations for ever.

1761.text: Psalm 106:32	They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

1762.text: Psalm 106:33	Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spoke unadvisedly with his lips.

1763.text: Psalm 106:34	They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:

1764.text: Psalm 106:35	But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

1765.text: Psalm 106:36	And they served their idols: which were a snare to them.

1766.text: Psalm 106:37	Yes, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons,

1767.text: Psalm 106:38	And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

1768.text: Psalm 106:39	Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went astray with their own inventions.

1769.text: Psalm 106:40	Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

1770.text: Psalm 106:41	And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

1771.text: Psalm 106:42	Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

1772.text: Psalm 106:43	Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel; and were brought low for their iniquity.

1773.text: Psalm 106:44	Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

1774.text: Psalm 106:45	And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

1775.text: Psalm 106:46	He made them also to be pitied by all those that carried them captives.

1776.text: Psalm 106:47	Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks to thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

1777.text: Psalm 106:48	Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.

1778.text: Psalm 107:1	O give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.

1779.text: Psalm 107:2	Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

1780.text: Psalm 107:3	And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

1781.text: Psalm 107:4	They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

1782.text: Psalm 107:5	Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

1783.text: Psalm 107:6	Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.

1784.text: Psalm 107:7	And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

1785.text: Psalm 107:8	Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

1786.text: Psalm 107:9	For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

1787.text: Psalm 107:10	Such as sit in darkness and in the shades of death, being bound in affliction and iron;

1788.text: Psalm 107:11	Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the Most High:

1789.text: Psalm 107:12	Therefore he brought down their heart with labor; they fell down, and there was none to help.

1790.text: Psalm 107:13	Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.

1791.text: Psalm 107:14	He brought them out of darkness and the shades of death, and broke their bands asunder.

1792.text: Psalm 107:15	Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

1793.text: Psalm 107:16	For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron asunder.

1794.text: Psalm 107:17	Fools, because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

1795.text: Psalm 107:18	Their soul abhorreth all manner of food; and they draw near to the gates of death.

1796.text: Psalm 107:19	Then they cry to the LORD in their trouble, he saveth them out of their distresses.

1797.text: Psalm 107:20	He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.

1798.text: Psalm 107:21	Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

1799.text: Psalm 107:22	And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

1800.text: Psalm 107:23	They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business on great waters;

1801.text: Psalm 107:24	These see the works of the LORD, and his wonders in the deep.

1802.text: Psalm 107:25	For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up its waves.

1803.text: Psalm 107:26	They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

1804.text: Psalm 107:27	They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wit’s end.

1805.text: Psalm 107:28	Then they cry to the LORD in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

1806.text: Psalm 107:29	He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves of the sea are still.

1807.text: Psalm 107:30	Then are they glad because they are quiet; so he bringeth them to their desired haven.

1808.text: Psalm 107:31	Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

1809.text: Psalm 107:32	Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

1810.text: Psalm 107:33	He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the water-springs into dry ground;

1811.text: Psalm 107:34	A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell in it.

1812.text: Psalm 107:35	He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into water-springs.

1813.text: Psalm 107:36	And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

1814.text: Psalm 107:37	And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

1815.text: Psalm 107:38	He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

1816.text: Psalm 107:39	Again, they are diminished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

1817.text: Psalm 107:40	He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

1818.text: Psalm 107:41	Yet he setteth the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.

1819.text: Psalm 107:42	The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

1820.text: Psalm 107:43	Whoever is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the loving-kindness of the LORD.

1821.text: Psalm 108:1	A Song or Psalm of David. O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

1822.text: Psalm 108:2	Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

1823.text: Psalm 108:3	I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises to thee among the nations.

1824.text: Psalm 108:4	For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth to the clouds.

1825.text: Psalm 108:5	Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

1826.text: Psalm 108:6	That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.

1827.text: Psalm 108:7	God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.

1828.text: Psalm 108:8	Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my lawgiver;

1829.text: Psalm 108:9	Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.

1830.text: Psalm 108:10	Who will bring me into the strong city: who will lead me into Edom?

1831.text: Psalm 108:11	Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our armies?

1832.text: Psalm 108:12	Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

1833.text: Psalm 108:13	Through God we shall do valiantly: for he will tread down our enemies.

1834.text: Psalm 109:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

1835.text: Psalm 109:2	For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

1836.text: Psalm 109:3	They encompassed me also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

1837.text: Psalm 109:4	For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself to prayer.

1838.text: Psalm 109:5	And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

1839.text: Psalm 109:6	Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

1840.text: Psalm 109:7	When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

1841.text: Psalm 109:8	Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

1842.text: Psalm 109:9	Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

1843.text: Psalm 109:10	Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

1844.text: Psalm 109:11	Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let strangers spoil his labor.

1845.text: Psalm 109:12	Let there be none to extend mercy to him: neither let there be any to favor his fatherless children.

1846.text: Psalm 109:13	Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

1847.text: Psalm 109:14	Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

1848.text: Psalm 109:15	Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

1849.text: Psalm 109:16	Because that he remembered not to show mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

1850.text: Psalm 109:17	As he loved cursing, so let it come to him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

1851.text: Psalm 109:18	As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

1852.text: Psalm 109:19	Let it be to him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle with which he is girded continually.

1853.text: Psalm 109:20	Let this be the reward of my adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

1854.text: Psalm 109:21	But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

1855.text: Psalm 109:22	For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

1856.text: Psalm 109:23	I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

1857.text: Psalm 109:24	My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

1858.text: Psalm 109:25	I became also a reproach to them: when they looked upon me they shook their heads.

1859.text: Psalm 109:26	Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

1860.text: Psalm 109:27	That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.

1861.text: Psalm 109:28	Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

1862.text: Psalm 109:29	Let my adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

1863.text: Psalm 109:30	I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yes, I will praise him among the multitude.

1864.text: Psalm 109:31	For he will stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.

1865.text: Psalm 110:1	A Psalm of David. The LORD said to my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thy enemies thy footstool.

1866.text: Psalm 110:2	The LORD will send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.

1867.text: Psalm 110:3	Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness: from the womb of the morning, thou hast the dew of thy youth.

1868.text: Psalm 110:4	The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedek.

1869.text: Psalm 110:5	The Lord at thy right hand will strike through kings in the day of his wrath.

1870.text: Psalm 110:6	He will judge among the heathen, he will fill the places with the dead bodies; he will wound the heads over many countries.

1871.text: Psalm 110:7	He will drink of the brook in the way: therefore will he lift up the head.

1872.text: Psalm 111:1	Praise ye the LORD. I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.

1873.text: Psalm 111:2	The works of the LORD are great, sought out by all them that have pleasure in them.

1874.text: Psalm 111:3	His work is honorable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

1875.text: Psalm 111:4	He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the LORD is gracious and full of compassion.

1876.text: Psalm 111:5	He hath given food to them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.

1877.text: Psalm 111:6	He hath shown his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

1878.text: Psalm 111:7	The works of his hands are verity and judgment; all his commandments are sure.

1879.text: Psalm 111:8	They stand fast for ever and ever, and are done in truth and uprightness.

1880.text: Psalm 111:9	He sent redemption to his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend is his name.

1881.text: Psalm 111:10	The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

1882.text: Psalm 112:1	Praise ye the LORD. Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.

1883.text: Psalm 112:2	His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

1884.text: Psalm 112:3	Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

1885.text: Psalm 112:4	To the upright there ariseth light in darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

1886.text: Psalm 112:5	A good man showeth favor, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

1887.text: Psalm 112:6	Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

1888.text: Psalm 112:7	He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.

1889.text: Psalm 112:8	His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he seeth his desire upon his enemies.

1890.text: Psalm 112:9	He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.

1891.text: Psalm 112:10	The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

1892.text: Psalm 113:1	Praise ye the LORD. Praise, O ye servants of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.

1893.text: Psalm 113:2	Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.

1894.text: Psalm 113:3	From the rising of the sun to the going down of the same the LORD’S name is to be praised.

1895.text: Psalm 113:4	The LORD is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.

1896.text: Psalm 113:5	Who is like to the LORD our God, who dwelleth on high.

1897.text: Psalm 113:6	Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!

1898.text: Psalm 113:7	He raiseth the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;

1899.text: Psalm 113:8	That he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.

1900.text: Psalm 113:9	He maketh the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the LORD.

1901.text: Psalm 114:1	When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of a foreign language;

1902.text: Psalm 114:2	Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.

1903.text: Psalm 114:3	The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.

1904.text: Psalm 114:4	The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

1905.text: Psalm 114:5	What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

1906.text: Psalm 114:6	Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?

1907.text: Psalm 114:7	Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

1908.text: Psalm 114:8	Who turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

1909.text: Psalm 115:1	Not to us, O LORD, not to us, but to thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth’s sake.

1910.text: Psalm 115:2	Why should the heathen say, Where is now their God?

1911.text: Psalm 115:3	But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatever he pleased.

1912.text: Psalm 115:4	Their idols are silver and gold; the work of men’s hands.

1913.text: Psalm 115:5	They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

1914.text: Psalm 115:6	They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

1915.text: Psalm 115:7	They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

1916.text: Psalm 115:8	They that make them are like them; so is every one that trusteth in them.

1917.text: Psalm 115:9	O Israel, trust thou in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

1918.text: Psalm 115:10	O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

1919.text: Psalm 115:11	Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

1920.text: Psalm 115:12	The LORD hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.

1921.text: Psalm 115:13	He will bless them that fear the LORD, both small and great.

1922.text: Psalm 115:14	The LORD will increase you more and more, you and your children.

1923.text: Psalm 115:15	Ye are blessed of the LORD who made heaven and earth.

1924.text: Psalm 115:16	The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORD’S: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

1925.text: Psalm 115:17	The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into silence.

1926.text: Psalm 115:18	But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for ever. Praise the LORD.

1927.text: Psalm 116:1	I love the LORD, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.

1928.text: Psalm 116:2	Because he hath inclined his ear to me, therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

1929.text: Psalm 116:3	The sorrows of death encompassed me, and the pains of hell came upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.

1930.text: Psalm 116:4	Then I called upon the name of the LORD; O LORD, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

1931.text: Psalm 116:5	Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yes, our God is merciful.

1932.text: Psalm 116:6	The LORD preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.

1933.text: Psalm 116:7	Return to thy rest, O my soul; for the LORD hath dealt bountifully with thee.

1934.text: Psalm 116:8	For thou hast delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

1935.text: Psalm 116:9	I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.

1936.text: Psalm 116:10	I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

1937.text: Psalm 116:11	I said in my haste, All men are liars.

1938.text: Psalm 116:12	What shall I render to the LORD for all his benefits towards me?

1939.text: Psalm 116:13	I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the LORD.

1940.text: Psalm 116:14	I will pay my vows to the LORD now in the presence of all his people.

1941.text: Psalm 116:15	Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.

1942.text: Psalm 116:16	O LORD, truly I am thy servant; I am thy servant, the son of thy handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.

1943.text: Psalm 116:17	I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the LORD.

1944.text: Psalm 116:18	I will pay my vows to the LORD now in the presence of all his people,

1945.text: Psalm 116:19	In the courts of the LORD’S house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.

1946.text: Psalm 117:1	O praise the LORD, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

1947.text: Psalm 117:2	For his merciful kindness is great towards us: and the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. Praise ye the LORD.

1948.text: Psalm 118:1	O give thanks to the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.

1949.text: Psalm 118:2	Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

1950.text: Psalm 118:3	Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

1951.text: Psalm 118:4	Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

1952.text: Psalm 118:5	I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, and set me in a large place.

1953.text: Psalm 118:6	The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do to me?

1954.text: Psalm 118:7	The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

1955.text: Psalm 118:8	It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.

1956.text: Psalm 118:9	It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.

1957.text: Psalm 118:10	All nations encompassed me: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.

1958.text: Psalm 118:11	They encompassed me; yes, they encompassed me: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

1959.text: Psalm 118:12	They encompassed me like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

1960.text: Psalm 118:13	Thou hast violently thrust at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.

1961.text: Psalm 118:14	The LORD is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

1962.text: Psalm 118:15	The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

1963.text: Psalm 118:16	The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

1964.text: Psalm 118:17	I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.

1965.text: Psalm 118:18	The LORD hath chastened me severely: but he hath not given me over to death.

1966.text: Psalm 118:19	Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will enter them, and I will praise the LORD:

1967.text: Psalm 118:20	This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.

1968.text: Psalm 118:21	I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

1969.text: Psalm 118:22	The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.

1970.text: Psalm 118:23	This is the LORD’S doing; it is wonderful in our eyes.

1971.text: Psalm 118:24	This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

1972.text: Psalm 118:25	Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

1973.text: Psalm 118:26	Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.

1974.text: Psalm 118:27	God is the LORD, who hath shown us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.

1975.text: Psalm 118:28	Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.

1976.text: Psalm 118:29	O give thanks to the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

1977.text: Psalm 119:1	ALEPH. Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.

1978.text: Psalm 119:2	Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

1979.text: Psalm 119:3	They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

1980.text: Psalm 119:4	Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.

1981.text: Psalm 119:5	O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

1982.text: Psalm 119:6	Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect to all thy commandments.

1983.text: Psalm 119:7	I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

1984.text: Psalm 119:8	I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

1985.text: Psalm 119:9	BETH. Wherewith shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed to it, according to thy word.

1986.text: Psalm 119:10	With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

1987.text: Psalm 119:11	Thy word have I hid in my heart, that I might not sin against thee.

1988.text: Psalm 119:12	Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.

1989.text: Psalm 119:13	With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

1990.text: Psalm 119:14	I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.

1991.text: Psalm 119:15	I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect to thy ways.

1992.text: Psalm 119:16	I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

1993.text: Psalm 119:17	GIMEL. Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.

1994.text: Psalm 119:18	Open thou my eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

1995.text: Psalm 119:19	I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

1996.text: Psalm 119:20	My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath to thy judgments at all times.

1997.text: Psalm 119:21	Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, who do err from thy commandments.

1998.text: Psalm 119:22	Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

1999.text: Psalm 119:23	Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

2000.text: Psalm 119:24	Thy testimonies also are my delight, and my counselors.

2001.text: Psalm 119:25	DALETH. My soul cleaveth to the dust: revive thou me according to thy word.

2002.text: Psalm 119:26	I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

2003.text: Psalm 119:27	Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

2004.text: Psalm 119:28	My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according to thy word.

2005.text: Psalm 119:29	Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

2006.text: Psalm 119:30	I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.

2007.text: Psalm 119:31	I have adhered to thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.

2008.text: Psalm 119:32	I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

2009.text: Psalm 119:33	HE. Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it to the end.

2010.text: Psalm 119:34	Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yes, I shall observe it with my whole heart.

2011.text: Psalm 119:35	Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for in that do I delight.

2012.text: Psalm 119:36	Incline my heart to thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

2013.text: Psalm 119:37	Turn away my eyes from beholding vanity; and revive thou me in thy way.

2014.text: Psalm 119:38	Establish thy word to thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.

2015.text: Psalm 119:39	Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.

2016.text: Psalm 119:40	Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: revive me in thy righteousness.

2017.text: Psalm 119:41	VAU. Let thy mercies come also to me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy word.

2018.text: Psalm 119:42	So shall I have with which to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

2019.text: Psalm 119:43	And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

2020.text: Psalm 119:44	So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

2021.text: Psalm 119:45	And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

2022.text: Psalm 119:46	I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

2023.text: Psalm 119:47	And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

2024.text: Psalm 119:48	My hands also will I lift to thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

2025.text: Psalm 119:49	ZAIN. Remember the word to thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

2026.text: Psalm 119:50	This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath revived me.

2027.text: Psalm 119:51	The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet I have not declined from thy law.

2028.text: Psalm 119:52	I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.

2029.text: Psalm 119:53	Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

2030.text: Psalm 119:54	Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

2031.text: Psalm 119:55	I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.

2032.text: Psalm 119:56	This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

2033.text: Psalm 119:57	CHETH. Thou art my portion, O LORD: I have said that I would keep thy words.

2034.text: Psalm 119:58	I entreated thy favor with my whole heart: be merciful to me according to thy word.

2035.text: Psalm 119:59	I thought on my ways, and turned my feet to thy testimonies.

2036.text: Psalm 119:60	I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

2037.text: Psalm 119:61	The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.

2038.text: Psalm 119:62	At midnight I will rise to give thanks to thee, because of thy righteous judgments.

2039.text: Psalm 119:63	I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

2040.text: Psalm 119:64	The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

2041.text: Psalm 119:65	TETH. Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according to thy word.

2042.text: Psalm 119:66	Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.
