2043.text: Psalm 119:67	Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

2044.text: Psalm 119:68	Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

2045.text: Psalm 119:69	The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.

2046.text: Psalm 119:70	Their heart is as gross as fat; but I delight in thy law.

2047.text: Psalm 119:71	It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

2048.text: Psalm 119:72	The law of thy mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver.

2049.text: Psalm 119:73	JOD. Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

2050.text: Psalm 119:74	They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

2051.text: Psalm 119:75	I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

2052.text: Psalm 119:76	Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word to thy servant.

2053.text: Psalm 119:77	Let thy tender mercies come to me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.

2054.text: Psalm 119:78	Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.

2055.text: Psalm 119:79	Let those that fear thee turn to me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

2056.text: Psalm 119:80	Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I may not be ashamed.

2057.text: Psalm 119:81	CAPH. My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.

2058.text: Psalm 119:82	My eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

2059.text: Psalm 119:83	For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet I do not forget thy statutes.

2060.text: Psalm 119:84	How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

2061.text: Psalm 119:85	The proud have digged pits for me, which are not according to thy law.

2062.text: Psalm 119:86	All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

2063.text: Psalm 119:87	They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

2064.text: Psalm 119:88	Revive me after thy loving-kindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

2065.text: Psalm 119:89	LAMED. For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in heaven.

2066.text: Psalm 119:90	Thy faithfulness is to all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

2067.text: Psalm 119:91	They continue this day according to thy ordinances: for all are thy servants.

2068.text: Psalm 119:92	Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in my affliction.

2069.text: Psalm 119:93	I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast revived me.

2070.text: Psalm 119:94	I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

2071.text: Psalm 119:95	The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.

2072.text: Psalm 119:96	I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

2073.text: Psalm 119:97	MEM. O how I love thy law! it is my meditation all the day.

2074.text: Psalm 119:98	Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than my enemies: for they are ever with me.

2075.text: Psalm 119:99	I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.

2076.text: Psalm 119:100	I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

2077.text: Psalm 119:101	I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

2078.text: Psalm 119:102	I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

2079.text: Psalm 119:103	How sweet are thy words to my taste! yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

2080.text: Psalm 119:104	Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

2081.text: Psalm 119:105	NUN. Thy word is a lamp to my feet, and a light to my path.

2082.text: Psalm 119:106	I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

2083.text: Psalm 119:107	I am afflicted very much: revive me, O LORD, according to thy word.

2084.text: Psalm 119:108	Accept, I beseech thee, the free-will-offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.

2085.text: Psalm 119:109	My soul is continually in my hand: yet I do not forget thy law.

2086.text: Psalm 119:110	The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

2087.text: Psalm 119:111	Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

2088.text: Psalm 119:112	I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes always, even to the end.

2089.text: Psalm 119:113	SAMECH. I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.

2090.text: Psalm 119:114	Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

2091.text: Psalm 119:115	Depart from me, ye evil-doers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

2092.text: Psalm 119:116	Uphold me according to thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

2093.text: Psalm 119:117	Support me, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect to thy statutes continually.

2094.text: Psalm 119:118	Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.

2095.text: Psalm 119:119	Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

2096.text: Psalm 119:120	My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

2097.text: Psalm 119:121	AIN. I have done judgment and justice; leave me not to my oppressors.

2098.text: Psalm 119:122	Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

2099.text: Psalm 119:123	My eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

2100.text: Psalm 119:124	Deal with thy servant according to thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

2101.text: Psalm 119:125	I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

2102.text: Psalm 119:126	It is time for thee, LORD, to work: for they have made void thy law.

2103.text: Psalm 119:127	Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yes, above fine gold.

2104.text: Psalm 119:128	Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.

2105.text: Psalm 119:129	PE. Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

2106.text: Psalm 119:130	The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding to the simple.

2107.text: Psalm 119:131	I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

2108.text: Psalm 119:132	Look thou upon me, and be merciful to me, as thou usest to do to those that love thy name.

2109.text: Psalm 119:133	Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

2110.text: Psalm 119:134	Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

2111.text: Psalm 119:135	Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: and teach me thy statutes.

2112.text: Psalm 119:136	Rivers of waters run down my eyes, because they keep not thy law.

2113.text: Psalm 119:137	TSADDI. Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.

2114.text: Psalm 119:138	Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.

2115.text: Psalm 119:139	My zeal hath consumed me; because my enemies have forgotten thy words.

2116.text: Psalm 119:140	Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

2117.text: Psalm 119:141	I am small and despised: yet I do not forget thy precepts.

2118.text: Psalm 119:142	Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.

2119.text: Psalm 119:143	Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.

2120.text: Psalm 119:144	The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

2121.text: Psalm 119:145	KOPH. I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O LORD: I will keep thy statutes.

2122.text: Psalm 119:146	I cried to thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

2123.text: Psalm 119:147	I came before the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

2124.text: Psalm 119:148	My eyes anticipated the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

2125.text: Psalm 119:149	Hear my voice, according to thy loving-kindness: O LORD, revive me according to thy judgment.

2126.text: Psalm 119:150	They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

2127.text: Psalm 119:151	Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.

2128.text: Psalm 119:152	Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

2129.text: Psalm 119:153	RESH. Consider my affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

2130.text: Psalm 119:154	Plead my cause, and deliver me: revive me according to thy word.

2131.text: Psalm 119:155	Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

2132.text: Psalm 119:156	Great are thy tender mercies, O LORD: revive me according to thy judgments.

2133.text: Psalm 119:157	Many are my persecutors and my enemies; yet I do not decline from thy testimonies.

2134.text: Psalm 119:158	I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

2135.text: Psalm 119:159	Consider how I love thy precepts: revive me, O LORD, according to thy loving-kindness.

2136.text: Psalm 119:160	Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.

2137.text: Psalm 119:161	SCHIN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause; but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

2138.text: Psalm 119:162	I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

2139.text: Psalm 119:163	I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.

2140.text: Psalm 119:164	Seven times a day do I praise thee, because of thy righteous judgments.

2141.text: Psalm 119:165	Great peace have they who love thy law: and nothing shall cause them to stumble.

2142.text: Psalm 119:166	LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and performed thy commandments.

2143.text: Psalm 119:167	My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

2144.text: Psalm 119:168	I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.

2145.text: Psalm 119:169	TAU. Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD: give me understanding according to thy word.

2146.text: Psalm 119:170	Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

2147.text: Psalm 119:171	My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

2148.text: Psalm 119:172	My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.

2149.text: Psalm 119:173	Let thy hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

2150.text: Psalm 119:174	I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and thy law is my delight.

2151.text: Psalm 119:175	Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

2152.text: Psalm 119:176	I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.

2153.text: Psalm 120:1	A Song of degrees. In my distress I cried to the LORD, and he heard me.

2154.text: Psalm 120:2	Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.

2155.text: Psalm 120:3	What shall be given to thee? or what shall be done to thee, thou false tongue?

2156.text: Psalm 120:4	Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

2157.text: Psalm 120:5	Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!

2158.text: Psalm 120:6	My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

2159.text: Psalm 120:7	I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.

2160.text: Psalm 121:1	A Song of degrees. I will lift up my eyes to the hills, from whence cometh my help.

2161.text: Psalm 121:2	My help cometh from the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

2162.text: Psalm 121:3	He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.

2163.text: Psalm 121:4	Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

2164.text: Psalm 121:5	The LORD is thy keeper: the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.

2165.text: Psalm 121:6	The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

2166.text: Psalm 121:7	The LORD will preserve thee from all evil: he will preserve thy soul.

2167.text: Psalm 121:8	The LORD will preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for ever.

2168.text: Psalm 122:1	A Song of degrees of David. I was glad when they said to me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.

2169.text: Psalm 122:2	Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.

2170.text: Psalm 122:3	Jerusalem is built as a city that is compact together:

2171.text: Psalm 122:4	Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, to the testimony of Israel, to give thanks to the name of the LORD.

2172.text: Psalm 122:5	For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

2173.text: Psalm 122:6	Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.

2174.text: Psalm 122:7	Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.

2175.text: Psalm 122:8	For my brethren and companions’ sake, I will now say, Peace be within thee.

2176.text: Psalm 122:9	Because of the house of the LORD our God I will seek thy good.

2177.text: Psalm 123:1	A Song of degrees. To thee I raise my eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

2178.text: Psalm 123:2	Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until he shall have mercy upon us.

2179.text: Psalm 123:3	Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us; for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

2180.text: Psalm 123:4	Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.

2181.text: Psalm 124:1	A Song of degrees of David. If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, now may Israel say;

2182.text: Psalm 124:2	If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, when men rose up against us:

2183.text: Psalm 124:3	Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

2184.text: Psalm 124:4	Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul:

2185.text: Psalm 124:5	Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

2186.text: Psalm 124:6	Blessed be the LORD, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.

2187.text: Psalm 124:7	Our soul hath escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we have escaped.

2188.text: Psalm 124:8	Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

2189.text: Psalm 125:1	A Song of degrees. They that trust in the LORD, shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.

2190.text: Psalm 125:2	As the mountains are round Jerusalem, so the LORD is around his people from henceforth even for ever.

2191.text: Psalm 125:3	For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands to iniquity.

2192.text: Psalm 125:4	Do good, O LORD, to those that are good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

2193.text: Psalm 125:5	As for such as turn aside to their crooked ways, the LORD shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.

2194.text: Psalm 126:1	A Song of degrees. When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.

2195.text: Psalm 126:2	Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The LORD hath done great things for them.

2196.text: Psalm 126:3	The LORD hath done great things for us; of which we are glad.

2197.text: Psalm 126:4	Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the south.

2198.text: Psalm 126:5	They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

2199.text: Psalm 126:6	He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless return with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

2200.text: Psalm 127:1	A Song of degrees for Solomon. Except the LORD shall build the house, they labor in vain that build it: except the LORD shall keep the city, the watchman waketh in vain.

2201.text: Psalm 127:2	It is vain for you to rise early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

2202.text: Psalm 127:3	Lo, children are a heritage of the LORD: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.

2203.text: Psalm 127:4	As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man: so are children of the youth.

2204.text: Psalm 127:5	Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.

2205.text: Psalm 128:1	A Song of degrees. Blessed is every one that feareth the LORD; that walketh in his ways.

2206.text: Psalm 128:2	For thou shalt eat the labor of thy hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

2207.text: Psalm 128:3	Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thy house: thy children like olive plants around thy table.

2208.text: Psalm 128:4	Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the LORD.

2209.text: Psalm 128:5	The LORD shall bless thee out of Zion: and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.

2210.text: Psalm 128:6	Yes, thou shalt see thy children’s children, and peace upon Israel.

2211.text: Psalm 129:1	A Song of degrees. Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:

2212.text: Psalm 129:2	Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.

2213.text: Psalm 129:3	The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.

2214.text: Psalm 129:4	The LORD is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.

2215.text: Psalm 129:5	Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.

2216.text: Psalm 129:6	Let them be as the grass upon the house-tops, which withereth before it groweth up:

2217.text: Psalm 129:7	With which the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves, his bosom.

2218.text: Psalm 129:8	Neither do they who go by, say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you: we bless you in the name of the LORD.

2219.text: Psalm 130:1	A Song of degrees. Out of the depths have I cried to thee, O LORD.

2220.text: Psalm 130:2	Lord, hear my voice: let thy ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

2221.text: Psalm 130:3	If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?

2222.text: Psalm 130:4	But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

2223.text: Psalm 130:5	I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

2224.text: Psalm 130:6	My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.

2225.text: Psalm 130:7	Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.

2226.text: Psalm 130:8	And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

2227.text: Psalm 131:1	A Song of degrees of David. LORD, my heart is not haughty, nor my eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.

2228.text: Psalm 131:2	Surely I have behaved and quieted myself as a child that is weaned by his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child.

2229.text: Psalm 131:3	Let Israel hope in the LORD from henceforth and for ever.

2230.text: Psalm 132:1	A Song of degrees. LORD, remember David and all his afflictions;

2231.text: Psalm 132:2	How he swore to the LORD, and vowed to the mighty God of Jacob;

2232.text: Psalm 132:3	Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

2233.text: Psalm 132:4	I will not give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids,

2234.text: Psalm 132:5	Until I find a place for the LORD, a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

2235.text: Psalm 132:6	Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.

2236.text: Psalm 132:7	We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

2237.text: Psalm 132:8	Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

2238.text: Psalm 132:9	Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

2239.text: Psalm 132:10	For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thy anointed.

2240.text: Psalm 132:11	The LORD hath sworn in truth to David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

2241.text: Psalm 132:12	If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them; their children also shall sit upon thy throne for ever.

2242.text: Psalm 132:13	For the LORD hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.

2243.text: Psalm 132:14	This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

2244.text: Psalm 132:15	I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

2245.text: Psalm 132:16	I will also clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

2246.text: Psalm 132:17	There will I make the horn of David to bud, I have ordained a lamp for my anointed.

2247.text: Psalm 132:18	His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

2248.text: Psalm 133:1	A Song of degrees of David. Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

2249.text: Psalm 133:2	It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron’s beard: that went down to the skirts of his garment;

2250.text: Psalm 133:3	As the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion: for there the LORD commanded the blessing, even life for ever.

2251.text: Psalm 134:1	A Song of degrees. Behold, bless ye the LORD, all ye servants of the LORD, who by night stand in the house of the LORD.

2252.text: Psalm 134:2	Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the LORD.

2253.text: Psalm 134:3	The LORD that made heaven and earth bless thee out of Zion.

2254.text: Psalm 135:1	Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the name of the LORD; praise him, O ye servants of the LORD.

2255.text: Psalm 135:2	Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God,

2256.text: Psalm 135:3	Praise the LORD; for the LORD is good; sing praises to his name; for it is pleasant.

2257.text: Psalm 135:4	For the LORD hath chosen Jacob to himself, and Israel for his peculiar treasure.

2258.text: Psalm 135:5	For I know that the LORD is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.

2259.text: Psalm 135:6	Whatever the LORD pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.

2260.text: Psalm 135:7	He causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.

2261.text: Psalm 135:8	Who smote the first-born of Egypt, both of man and beast.

2262.text: Psalm 135:9	Who sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.

2263.text: Psalm 135:10	Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;

2264.text: Psalm 135:11	Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:

2265.text: Psalm 135:12	And gave their land for a heritage, a heritage to Israel his people.

2266.text: Psalm 135:13	Thy name, O LORD, endureth for ever; and thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.

2267.text: Psalm 135:14	For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent concerning his servants.

2268.text: Psalm 135:15	The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

2269.text: Psalm 135:16	They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not.

2270.text: Psalm 135:17	They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.

2271.text: Psalm 135:18	They that make them are like them: so is every one that trusteth in them.

2272.text: Psalm 135:19	Bless the LORD, O house of Israel: bless the LORD, O house of Aaron:

2273.text: Psalm 135:20	Bless the LORD, O house of Levi: ye that fear the LORD, bless the LORD.

2274.text: Psalm 135:21	Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, who dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.

2275.text: Psalm 136:1	O give thanks to the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2276.text: Psalm 136:2	O give thanks to the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2277.text: Psalm 136:3	O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2278.text: Psalm 136:4	To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2279.text: Psalm 136:5	To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2280.text: Psalm 136:6	To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2281.text: Psalm 136:7	To him that made great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2282.text: Psalm 136:8	The sun to rule by day: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2283.text: Psalm 136:9	The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2284.text: Psalm 136:10	To him that smote Egypt in their first-born: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2285.text: Psalm 136:11	And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2286.text: Psalm 136:12	With a strong hand, and with an out-stretched arm: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2287.text: Psalm 136:13	To him who divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2288.text: Psalm 136:14	And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2289.text: Psalm 136:15	But overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red sea: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2290.text: Psalm 136:16	To him who led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2291.text: Psalm 136:17	To him who smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2292.text: Psalm 136:18	And slew famous kings: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2293.text: Psalm 136:19	Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2294.text: Psalm 136:20	And Og king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2295.text: Psalm 136:21	And gave their land for a heritage: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2296.text: Psalm 136:22	Even a heritage to Israel his servant: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2297.text: Psalm 136:23	Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endureth for ever:

2298.text: Psalm 136:24	And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2299.text: Psalm 136:25	Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2300.text: Psalm 136:26	O give thanks to the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2301.text: Psalm 137:1	By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

2302.text: Psalm 137:2	We hung our harps upon the willows in the midst of it.

2303.text: Psalm 137:3	For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

2304.text: Psalm 137:4	How shall we sing the LORD’S song in a foreign land?

2305.text: Psalm 137:5	If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her skill.

2306.text: Psalm 137:6	If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

2307.text: Psalm 137:7	Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Raze it, raze it, even to its foundation.

2308.text: Psalm 137:8	O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

2309.text: Psalm 137:9	Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.

2310.text: Psalm 138:1	A Psalm of David. I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise to thee.

2311.text: Psalm 138:2	I will worship towards thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy loving-kindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.

2312.text: Psalm 138:3	In the day when I cried thou didst answer me, and strengthen me with strength in my soul.

2313.text: Psalm 138:4	All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, when they hear the words of thy mouth.

2314.text: Psalm 138:5	Yes, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD: for great is the glory of the LORD.

2315.text: Psalm 138:6	Though the LORD is high, yet hath he respect to the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.

2316.text: Psalm 138:7	Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou wilt stretch forth thy hand against the wrath of my enemies, and thy right hand will save me.

2317.text: Psalm 138:8	The LORD will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever: forsake not the works thy own hands.

2318.text: Psalm 139:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.

2319.text: Psalm 139:2	Thou knowest my down-sitting and my up rising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

2320.text: Psalm 139:3	Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

2321.text: Psalm 139:4	For there is not a word on my tongue, but lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.

2322.text: Psalm 139:5	Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thy hand upon me.

2323.text: Psalm 139:6	Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain to it.

2324.text: Psalm 139:7	Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

2325.text: Psalm 139:8	If I ascend into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

2326.text: Psalm 139:9	If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

2327.text: Psalm 139:10	Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

2328.text: Psalm 139:11	If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

2329.text: Psalm 139:12	Yes, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

2330.text: Psalm 139:13	For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.

2331.text: Psalm 139:14	I will praise thee: for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: wonderful are thy works; and that my soul well knoweth.

2332.text: Psalm 139:15	My substance was not hid from thee when I was made in secret, and curiously formed in the lowest parts of the earth.

2333.text: Psalm 139:16	Thy eyes saw my substance, yet being imperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

2334.text: Psalm 139:17	How precious also are thy thoughts to me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

2335.text: Psalm 139:18	If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

2336.text: Psalm 139:19	Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

2337.text: Psalm 139:20	For they speak against thee wickedly, and thy enemies take thy name in vain.

2338.text: Psalm 139:21	Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

2339.text: Psalm 139:22	I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them my enemies.

2340.text: Psalm 139:23	Search me, O God, and know my heart; try me, and know my thoughts:

2341.text: Psalm 139:24	And see if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

2342.text: Psalm 140:1	To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;

2343.text: Psalm 140:2	Who imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they assembled for war.

2344.text: Psalm 140:3	They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adder’s poison is under their lips. Selah.

2345.text: Psalm 140:4	Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.

2346.text: Psalm 140:5	The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the way side: they have set gins for me. Selah.

2347.text: Psalm 140:6	I said to the LORD, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O LORD.

2348.text: Psalm 140:7	O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

2349.text: Psalm 140:8	Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.

2350.text: Psalm 140:9	As for the head of those that encompass me, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

2351.text: Psalm 140:10	Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not again.

2352.text: Psalm 140:11	Let not an evil speaker be established on the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

2353.text: Psalm 140:12	I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.

2354.text: Psalm 140:13	Surely the righteous shall give thanks to thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

2355.text: Psalm 141:1	A Psalm of David. LORD, I cry to thee: make haste to me; give ear to my voice, when I cry to thee.

2356.text: Psalm 141:2	Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

2357.text: Psalm 141:3	Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

2358.text: Psalm 141:4	Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practice wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

2359.text: Psalm 141:5	Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.

2360.text: Psalm 141:6	When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.

2361.text: Psalm 141:7	Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

2362.text: Psalm 141:8	But my eyes are to thee, O GOD the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.

2363.text: Psalm 141:9	Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.

2364.text: Psalm 141:10	Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst I escape.

2365.text: Psalm 142:1	Maschil of David; a prayer when he was in the cave. I cried to the LORD with my voice; with my voice to the LORD I made my supplication.

2366.text: Psalm 142:2	I poured out my complaint before him; I showed before him my trouble.

2367.text: Psalm 142:3	When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way in which I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

2368.text: Psalm 142:4	I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.

2369.text: Psalm 142:5	I cried to thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.

2370.text: Psalm 142:6	Attend to my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

2371.text: Psalm 142:7	Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall encompass me; for thou wilt deal bountifully with me.

2372.text: Psalm 143:1	A Psalm of David. Hear my prayer, O LORD, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.

2373.text: Psalm 143:2	And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

2374.text: Psalm 143:3	For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.

2375.text: Psalm 143:4	Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.

2376.text: Psalm 143:5	I remember the days of old, I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.

2377.text: Psalm 143:6	I stretch forth my hands to thee: my soul thirsteth after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.

2378.text: Psalm 143:7	Hear me speedily, O LORD: my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like them that go down into the pit.

2379.text: Psalm 143:8	Cause me to hear thy loving-kindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way in which I should walk; for I lift up my soul to thee.

2380.text: Psalm 143:9	Deliver me, O LORD, from my enemies: I flee to thee to hide me.

2381.text: Psalm 143:10	Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

2382.text: Psalm 143:11	Revive me, O LORD, for thy name’s sake: for thy righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.

2383.text: Psalm 143:12	And of thy mercy cut off my enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant.

2384.text: Psalm 144:1	A Psalm of David. Blessed be the LORD my strength, who teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight;

2385.text: Psalm 144:2	My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

2386.text: Psalm 144:3	LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

2387.text: Psalm 144:4	Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

2388.text: Psalm 144:5	Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

2389.text: Psalm 144:6	Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot thy arrows, and destroy them.

2390.text: Psalm 144:7	Send thy hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

2391.text: Psalm 144:8	Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

2392.text: Psalm 144:9	I will sing a new song to thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises to thee.

2393.text: Psalm 144:10	It is he that giveth salvation to kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

2394.text: Psalm 144:11	Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:

2395.text: Psalm 144:12	That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:

2396.text: Psalm 144:13	That our granaries may be full, affording all manner of store; that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

2397.text: Psalm 144:14	That our oxen may be strong to labor; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.

2398.text: Psalm 144:15	Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yes, happy is that people, whose God is the LORD.

2399.text: Psalm 145:1	David’s Psalm of praise. I will extol thee, my God, O king; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.

2400.text: Psalm 145:2	Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.

2401.text: Psalm 145:3	Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

2402.text: Psalm 145:4	One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.

2403.text: Psalm 145:5	I will speak of the glorious honor of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

2404.text: Psalm 145:6	And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.

2405.text: Psalm 145:7	They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing of thy righteousness.

2406.text: Psalm 145:8	The LORD is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.

2407.text: Psalm 145:9	The LORD is good to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.

2408.text: Psalm 145:10	All thy works shall praise thee, O LORD; and thy saints shall bless thee.

2409.text: Psalm 145:11	They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power;

2410.text: Psalm 145:12	To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of his kingdom.

2411.text: Psalm 145:13	Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.

2412.text: Psalm 145:14	The LORD upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that are bowed down.

2413.text: Psalm 145:15	The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their food in due season.

2414.text: Psalm 145:16	Thou openest thy hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living creature.

2415.text: Psalm 145:17	The LORD is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.

2416.text: Psalm 145:18	The LORD is nigh to all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.

2417.text: Psalm 145:19	He will fulfill the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry, and will save them.

2418.text: Psalm 145:20	The LORD preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked will he destroy.

2419.text: Psalm 145:21	My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD: and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

2420.text: Psalm 146:1	Praise ye the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.

2421.text: Psalm 146:2	While I live will I praise the LORD: I will sing praises to my God while I have any being.

2422.text: Psalm 146:3	Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.

2423.text: Psalm 146:4	His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.

2424.text: Psalm 146:5	Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God:

2425.text: Psalm 146:6	Who made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that is in them: who keepeth truth for ever:

2426.text: Psalm 146:7	Who executeth judgment for the oppressed: who giveth food to the hungry. The LORD looseth the prisoners:

2427.text: Psalm 146:8	The LORD openeth the eyes of the blind: the LORD raiseth them that are bowed down: the LORD loveth the righteous:

2428.text: Psalm 146:9	The LORD preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.

2429.text: Psalm 146:10	The LORD will reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise ye the LORD.

2430.text: Psalm 147:1	Praise ye the LORD: for it is good to sing praises to our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.

2431.text: Psalm 147:2	The LORD buildeth up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.

2432.text: Psalm 147:3	He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

2433.text: Psalm 147:4	He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.

2434.text: Psalm 147:5	Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.

2435.text: Psalm 147:6	The LORD lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.

2436.text: Psalm 147:7	Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp to our God:

2437.text: Psalm 147:8	Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.

2438.text: Psalm 147:9	He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.

2439.text: Psalm 147:10	He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.

2440.text: Psalm 147:11	The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.

2441.text: Psalm 147:12	Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

2442.text: Psalm 147:13	For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.

2443.text: Psalm 147:14	He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.

2444.text: Psalm 147:15	He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

2445.text: Psalm 147:16	He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes.

2446.text: Psalm 147:17	He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?

2447.text: Psalm 147:18	He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.

2448.text: Psalm 147:19	He showeth his word to Jacob, his statutes and his judgments to Israel.

2449.text: Psalm 147:20	He hath not dealt so with any nation: and as for his judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the LORD.

2450.text: Psalm 148:1	Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the LORD from the heavens: praise him in the hights.

2451.text: Psalm 148:2	Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.

2452.text: Psalm 148:3	Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars of light.

2453.text: Psalm 148:4	Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that are above the heavens.

2454.text: Psalm 148:5	Let them praise the name of the LORD: for he commanded, and they were created.

2455.text: Psalm 148:6	He hath also established them for ever and ever: he hath made a decree which shall not pass.

2456.text: Psalm 148:7	Praise the LORD from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:

2457.text: Psalm 148:8	Fire, and hail; snow, and vapors; stormy wind fulfilling his word:

2458.text: Psalm 148:9	Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:

2459.text: Psalm 148:10	Beasts, and all cattle; creeping animals, and flying fowl:

2460.text: Psalm 148:11	Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:

2461.text: Psalm 148:12	Both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:

2462.text: Psalm 148:13	Let them praise the name of the LORD: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.

2463.text: Psalm 148:14	He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near to him. Praise ye the LORD.

2464.text: Psalm 149:1	Praise ye the LORD. Sing to the LORD a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.

2465.text: Psalm 149:2	Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

2466.text: Psalm 149:3	Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises to him with the timbrel and harp:

2467.text: Psalm 149:4	For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.

2468.text: Psalm 149:5	Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.

2469.text: Psalm 149:6	Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;

2470.text: Psalm 149:7	To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;

2471.text: Psalm 149:8	To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

2472.text: Psalm 149:9	To execute upon them the judgment written: this honor have all his saints. Praise ye the LORD.

2473.text: Psalm 150:1	Praise ye the LORD. Praise God in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power.

2474.text: Psalm 150:2	Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

2475.text: Psalm 150:3	Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.

2476.text: Psalm 150:4	Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs.

2477.text: Psalm 150:5	Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals.

2478.text: Psalm 150:6	Let every thing that hath breath praise the LORD. Praise ye the LORD.
